text: Update: The SDX goes straight here. Before you had to take the Deuce. Many stores but deals are so-so. Two food courts is a plus. Other than that, nothing special. Still a place to check out.
Nice location, great place to go shopping if you don't want to deal with the typical mall.

What better way to burn off the Christmas calories than to go walk around the Las Vegas Premium Outlets, look for bargains, and then ask your parents to bu them all for you. My family made it an affair to take advantage of the bargains we can get at all the outlets in this place. It is indoor so there's no need to worry about the freezing weather outside. Along with the crowd of people, you can pretty much walk around and visit each outlet with your two piece suit, speedo or nothing at all. LOL! Some of the outlets we visited were:

Ann Taylor
Dickies
Levi's
adidas
Nautica
Banana Republic
Perry Ellis
Izod
Quicksilver
Clark's Bostonian
Dr. Scholl's
Ecko (my personal favorite!)

There's plenty more outlets available but some of the outlets were kinda if-fy. In the end, each of us were joyfully carrying a bag or tow or three or four... you get the idea!, of all the things we things we got at a bargain price!!!

This place is more of a regular retail mall with some factory/outlet store sprinkled throughout. Good deals at the factory/outlet stores for sure.  I like that it is an indoor mall. Don't have to worry about crazy hot (or cold or windy) Vegas weather. Food court is pretty basic, not that great. There is a Starbucks so that's nice.

The worst service from these attendants ever.  I guess if you don't have an education you need to work somewhere.  I would think that Aeropostale screens their people to at least hire people with an ounce of customer service skills.  Worst part is that the manager condones the behavior.  Worst attitudes, may as well be in a war zone then at least it would make a little sense.

What the heck is going on with all the construction! Can't even enter or exit through the middle entrance! gah.

This mall is pretty big with a lot of cool stores that I normally like to shop at. Unfortunately, not a lot of the stores have good sales going on. I find that Premium Outlets by downtown has a lot better deals. 

They seriously need to update their directory too! I swear, my mom and I walked up and down the mall at least twice looking for a chef''s outlet, and we just figured they have closed down since a lot of the units looked closed. Parking is horrendous. And the mall is usually packed even at 10am. You are constantly weaving and dodging your way through people and kiosk sales people.

Ugh, and there are kiosks everywhere. And they all want to bug you and sample their product of you. I've learned to not make eye contact and to ignore them when they talk to you. 

I probably will go back just because it is close by to where I live, but I was ready to do some shopping today, and didn't find ANYTHING at all. I was very disappointed to say the least..

I walked into the store ,no one said hello. As I was looking for some sneakers I couldn't find what I wanted I had to ask someone for help they were very unfriendly no custermer service at all will not go back!,

I like this outlet there's a lot of food places in the same parking lot as the outlets, it's located on las Vegas Blvd between blue diamond and warm springs, the Nike out let is my favorite place to visit here I always tend to find good deals on shoes here. My daughter loves finding shoes here too. It's a fairly decent size outlet with tons of stores to choose from .

Go to gap. Great prices and such cute clothes!  My toddlers entire wardrobe is gap head to toe. They always have really good sales and I've still got hoodies from when he was younger that have been washed numerous times and still look so good

The south is the same as the north but inside and air conditioned.  If your here to really shop bring a suitcase. Actually buy the suitcase here. They're cheap too. Great brands at big savings. Spent a day here. Filled a suitcase. Enough said. Only reason not 5 because everything is not quite as cheap as people are saying. Remember tax goes on top in the U.S.

I found a couple of good stores here but the mall looks run down. Some stores look like warehouses. Food court is okay. They should do some renovation, other than that it's not bad. Also a lot of tourists.

Das Premium Outlet Center South liegt etwa in der Höhe des Flughafens und bietet wie mehrere Vorredner bereits angemerkt haben nicht so sehr PREMIUM aber doch relativ viel Auswahl und viel preiswertes für diejenigen, die nicht immer nur bei GUCCI oder bei BRIONI einkaufen. Ich habe letztens meinem alten Vater im Hat Shop für 100 bucks einen schönen braunen Stetson erstanden, den er jetzt mit viel Freude und großem Stolz trägt.

This is such a perfect model for high-end shopping, great little craft shops, and for the Vegas newbies who wants to find something fabulous to where I highly recommend this for anybody coming to the northside. And the cheesecake factory is absolutely super great service at the bar!!!

Got some pretty good deals but you have to hunt for them!
NOT all stores are outlet or factory stores other than that is was clean cool and well maintained. Great variety of stores and places to have lunch.
Will return

SO after an annoying time at the Las Vegas North Premium Outlets (see other reviews) we decided we would try this outlet mall. 

Well this place wasn't much better. The Kiosk's here are just as annoying...we had some crazy dried fruit stand lady actually yell..yes YELL at us after we declined her free sample of coconut. She asked if we wanted to try some, I said "no thank you" and she literately snarled "well have a SUPER DAY!!" in an extremely snide and rude tone..to add to the fact that she YELLED it at us. 

Don't shop here if you like personal space because the Kiosk people here do not understand this concept.

Certain people that usually shop there is looking for discounts on things that they need.  I'm one of those. Anyways, I've just leaving there and as I was getting in my car, a homeless person was trying to open my door.  I started my car and was about to back out, that homeless person was standing my way.  I've asked to move or become a pancake.  It was going on for 20 mins and security was helpful and detained the homeless person.  Not recommended if your shopping alone.

Na, ich weiß nicht  dieses Outlet wirkt so gar nicht Premim und kann mit allen anderen amerikanischen Shopping-Paradiesen nicht mithalten.
Es erinnert mich an die Great Mall nahe San Francisco. Auch hier ist das gesamte Center überdacht und daher  Pluspunkt in Las Vegas  etwa auf Biofresh-Temperatur gekühlt.
Aber irgenwie ist alles chaotisch, auch gibt es viele un-Marken  alles in allem würde ich klar abraten und die anderen Malls und Outlets in Las Vegas empfehlen!

Went shopping last day of trip. Decided to stop by the food court to eat not kidding was extremely gross floor was dirty all available tables were dirty. Went to mall office and blasted the operations director on the grossest food court I have ever seen.  Quite shameful. 

Dec 28,2016. Had a call from Victoria from the Mall managers office asking about what had happened that day. She also spoke about how she was going to rectify the issue and apologized. Victoria was very professional and courteous I look forward to shopping at the mall next time I am in town.

I came here when it was Belz, but I see it's been all made-over like? Oh. Well.... Fine. Have it your way then, Belz. 

This place is (was?) ok, deals are to be had. It's not like one of those malls where you're like "uhh, isn't this meant to be an outlet? where the deals at?", it's legit deal-filled.

However I do think Belz is a more memorable name. So I'm going to call it Belz.

Der Zusatz premium im Namen ist sicherlich nicht angebracht. Die Premium Marken sucht man hier vergebens, hier sollte man sich besser an die Malls im Stadtzentrum halten. Wer die normalen Brands sucht wird hier aber fuendig. Trotz der endlich durchgefuehrten Renovierung ist der Gesamteindruck dennoch nicht Premium. Lange Schlangen beim bezahlen und Kleinhaendler auf den Gaengen die einem permanent etwas aufschwaetzen wollen. Wenn man preisguenstig einkaufen will ist es aber einen Besuch wert. Auf die guenstigen Outletpreise gibt es meiszens noch 30, 50 oder gar 70% Rabatt.
Always fresh because they are so busy that's the key always going to bizzies food court in town that is the key to getting the freshest food

Great prices and quality stuff. I got new work clothes and the always under rated underwear and socks. I got a great haul for about $350. Most of the pants I got were under $20 and the polo shirts the same. Next time I want to go to the high end stores. My friend got some great deals.

Clothing shoes, clothing & shoes everywhere you go, everywhere you look, more clothing and shoes. If you are in the market for clothing and shoes this is a spot. You will have so much to chose from in this vast location you will see be seeing double. Not only are there multiples of stores if you are paying attention you will see the same merchandise in different places throughout. If you have a day and the patientence of Mother Theresa you might be able to score the exact thing that you really wanted at another store.

Everytime I go to Vegas, I always come to this outlet. There's always something reasonable to spend your money for. I like going here than gambling, whether you spent your money here or not, you are still a sure winner.
This outlet SUCKS.  The only store worth visiting is the Nike Outlet.  That's it.  Don't waste your time here.

The kiosk vendors are rude and aggressive,  so much so that I left after the 7th sales person said "here's a sample for your sun spots".  The 6th person said free sample for your wrinkles.  I probably need both but I'll leave the criticism to my dermatologist.  The majority of the shops sell athletic wear so if you are looking for ladies work clothes this isn't the best spot.
This outlet has improved from the last time I was there 2010. Great stores with good discounts. You can spend hours here.
Got some good bargains.  The mall feels a bit dark and dreary.  Needs an update.

This place has been remodeled and looks nice, especially from the outside. They have a huge selection of stores. Always a ton of tourists and tour buses. The one thing that really bothers me and prevents me from giving it a higher rating is all the kiosks in the middle of the narrow walkway. So many vendors bothering me to try a lotion or a steamer. I just want to shop and not be bothered. If you can get passed that and the crowds...it's not too bad.

Das Las Vegas Outlet Center wirkt auf mich immer etwas "unaufgeräumt", obwohl es das gar nicht ist.
Viele namenhafte Marken sind hier vertreten, aber auch viele mir nicht so bekannte Namen.
Es handelt sich hierbei um eine überdachte, also innenliegende Mall.


 Parkmöglichkeiten befinden sich auf dem großen Parkplatz vor der Mall im Freien (kein Parkhaus).


 Es wird z.Zt. dort umgebaut und etwas erweitert. Ab 17 März sollen dort noch "Under Armour", "Guess Factory Store", "True Religion", "Toys"R"Us Outlet", "Subway" sowie "New Balance Factory Store" neu hinzukommen. Ab April noch einige weitere Geschäfte.
Heute wurde noch kräftig gebaut und der halbe Parkplatz war gesperrt.


 Irgendwie gefällt mir die Premium Outlet Mall (http://www.qype.com/place/171849-Las-Vegas-Premium-Outlets-Las-Vegas) in Las Vegas Down Town viel besser.
Good prices and options or shopping. Of course if you're looking for stylish clothes this may not be the place but good for general shopping.

LOVE THIS MALL!  And I'm THRILLED to say that we shopped all over the mall on Black Friday without getting shot, pepper sprayed, arrested or otherwise injured :)  It's our tradition to Black Friday here & I LOVE IT!  There are some GREAT stores, GREAT service & some AWESOME deals to be had.  You do have to search 'em out, but TOTALLY worth it.  Some stores have better deals than others, which is why you have to search.  But I do LOVE Nike, Adidas, Bass shoes, Champion & LOTS more!  This place is DEFINITELY worth the visit.  Have FUN :)

Right next to my hotel 
3 min walk from it. Couldn't be better.
Didn't bring rainy day clothing.

I love this outlet since the remodel. The stores are better and it is easy to access all of them from any spot in the parking lot. I usually shop here for my sons clothes and shoes which I can get for a great price at vans, gymboree, converse, or stride rite. It is a great place to shop whether you have time to stroll and shop or if you just need to run in and out.

Only been in Vegas a few months and LOVE this place! Prices are fantastic in most stores and my daughter loves the big merry go round in the court. 
Must shop here wether you're a tourist or local!

June 3, 2013

Found my son Pumas that were originally $60 on sale for $30, so that was nice. 

Went to Disney store and found a Mickey trading pin for 3.99 heh heh heh, made me and my lanyard VERY happy!!!!!

Took the SDX bus from the strip here.  $14.00 per person for 24 hour ticket.

I'm starting to lose all interest in this location due to the dismal customer service I've received on a number of occasions. My most recent experience made me want to forbid all visiting guests from visiting this outlet. At check out, an employee of the Adidas store informed me that the item I wanted to purchase would be 50% off on President's Day. When I returned the following day, another visit solely to purchase the item, that particular employee was not present and the manager refused to honor his (mis)representation. Additionally, she appeared as flippant and unapologetic. I won't be going back!

So after we left The Town Square, we came here to the Outlet. We walked around checking out different stores and kiosks... Needless to say, we walked from one end of the Outlet to the other end just because we had nothing else to do for the day. We ended up buying two little monkeys that are magnetic for the frides (for my newphews).. The oldest one keeps asking for the monkeys that can wrap around you.. one that we saw at the stores in the airports,....I got him a mini version, but will get him the big one as well. We got them from the souvenir spot. Then we bought these slimy balls that when we you throw then down on the counter, they splat then return to their original shapes. $4.99 plus tax for each one.. But there was a special... if you bought two, the third one was free. We also bought tshirts that had gangsta Mario from Super Mario Bros on them for Lil Man and the two of them. They were $14.99 for each shirt plus a extra $1 to have "Las Vegas" added. And of course I had Las Vegas added to all three shirts. The last thing that we bought was a model of a Chinook (Army plane). We chatted with the sales guy for quite some time. He was trying to convince my son and me why a little plane (not the Chinook)...one that could fit in your palm, was a bargain... Telling us that it normally runs $79.99 plus tax, yet he was willing to let us walk out of the outlet with a price of $40... YEAH RIGHT... Lil Man asked about the Chinook...And the guy gave his pitch about how it costs $139.99 plus tax, but was willing to give it to us at $80. Well well well, we walked out of the outlet with only paying $70 for it and called it a day so that we could go home and test out the new gadget that we bought. Both of us had fun last night playing with it. It is a remote controled Chinook. We had a fanatastic time hanging out and playing with it.

The prices her CAN NOT be beat! I take all my friends/family that are visiting because everything is such a good deal. They have a good variety of stores too. I like the way the outlet is set up because if you are there for a certain store, you can just park near it and parking is plentiful. I try not to go during summer time because it can be quite busy and some tourists GO HAMMMM and you might get trampled lol. Other than that, I really have no complaints.

Really great, fun place. The shops tend to be pricier than normal, more boutique like. Love it in the summer time when the splash pads are up and running. Love all of the activities they hold year round for the general public.

I've been living in Las Vegas two years now,and I can't believe I never visited the outlet mall before,I always go to north premium outlet because it's closer to where I live,but I love this location it's close and all my favorite store are close to one another and the best thing it's indoor,so no matter if it's hot or cold I can always get my shopping done!! I'm so excited to go back soon.
Everyone was kind and courteous. I had a good experience. I was happy with the merchandise I purchased.

Not my favorite. If I'm in need of something on a moment's notice, I'll stop in. Otherwise, I will drive the extra 15 minutes to the North Premium Outlet mall, or over to Town Square. Three stars for convenience, two stars for store selection.
What a great shopping center! So many different stores! They also have a food court. We stopped here before we went to the airport and didn't realize how close and convenient it was!

Typical mall with many stores but you must be a smart shopper and know a bargain when you see it.  Food courts seem dull, where is the Burger King, Mickey-D's, Taco Bell?  Hand sanitizer dispensers located at various locations throughout the mall but most are empty and have been for a week or more.  I guess dirty hands spice up the dull food.  Hours are great.

Pretty big outlet. I am happy with the selection of stores here. I walked into Charlotte Russe, Nike, Adidas, Sketchers, Dr. Scholls, another shoe store that I can't remember the name to, and a tux shop. Employees in these stores were nice especially the guy in the Dr. Scholls. He pointed me in the right direction for a particular shoe at a tux shop. Good amount of food selection as well. There is a carousel for the kids to ride.

Always a great place to look for sales on brand named clothing, shoes, household stuff, etc... Huge selection of stores to choose from!  It's also indoors. Some stores you don't find in the other Vegas outlets.  I would say they could have better food selections.  There's also a huge carousel for the kids! Although It's a little pricey if you ask me.  I believe it's $2 a ride! Right now there's quite a bit of construction goin' on & it seems like it may start looking like the other outlet, which is outdoors.

Still ben my favorite place to shopping in Las Vegas ... I LOVE IT .. 

Sigue siendo mi lugar favorito en Las Vegas para hacer mis compras.. ME ENCANTAAA

For an outlet mall, stores are still pretty pricey. Parking is stupid, especially when trying to get to the food places near Las Vegas Blvd. I've worked in a couple of these stores before and they treat their employees terrible, which explains the bad customer service most of the stores offer. It's a pretty touristy place considering the amount of people you'll see hauling their suitcases around. Tiny walkways crowded with those annoying vendors trying to sell you some hot new toy your kid doesn't need or some magical anti wrinkle cream made from the mud of the Irish springs-- because every teenagers needs that, right? Overall not really my scene for shopping. 

I do, however, really enjoy their food kiosks. I'll never pass up a chance for Starbucks, Annie's pretzels, or Dunkin Doughnuts! For some reason, the food vendors seem like the only ones to hire a friendly staff.

This is an indoor mall with no frills... no fancy decorations that you find in modern new malls. Just rows of shops in an old drab building, but what they lack in eye candy, they make up for in deals. It's a little lower-end than the north outlets, but there are still some pretty good shops.. and best of all, it's fully indoors and has waaay better lunch spots (two food courts inside, and outside past the parking lot is stuff like (off the top of my head) Chipotle, McDonalds, Five Guys, Dennys, Chilis, etc. 

Pros:
-They do have higher end shops like Coach, Michael Kors, Bose, Ann Taylor, Swarovski, etc. But not as many as the North premium outlets.
-Lots of lunch options
-Fully indoors (North premium outlets is outdoors)

Cons:
-Not very impressive... the building is so drab and depressing.
-Very crowded! Full of tourists from everywhere.
-Parking is always crowded. Try and park at the back or towards the end of the building.

I love this outlet.  It is located on Las Vegas blvd and Warm Springs, near the airport.  It has a Lane Bryant Outlet store for us big girls.  They are missing a Torrid Outlet.  Loving the disneyland outlet on the outside in the parking lot.

Once upon a time, this was the Belz Outlet Mall. Then it became the Outlet Center. Belz was cool, the Outlet Center was lame. 

Now, it's become the Premium Outlets of Las Vegas-South. Let me tell you, it is quite the impovement.

The outside looks almost the same as the original Premium Outlets. Now the way it looks inside is still rather....stale. They need to work on that. That said, they do have a much better selection of stores now, with the already existing stores being vastly improved. The Niketown here is far better than the one at the North outlets in my opinion. This is also the area with the highest concentration of Dunkin' Donuts locations in Vegas, with two inside the mall and one in the parking lot. :D (There really aren't enough locations of those here). I'm really upset they closed the music store (Music 4 Less) though, one of the best music stores ever. Then again, they brought down the carousel that used to be at the Meadows Mall, so I suppose that's an improvement. 

The biggest problem with this mall is still there however: The layout. It's essentially a 0.5 mile long strip of a building. The thing that sucks most about this is parking at one end, having to go to a specific store, looking at the map and then realizing it's all the way at the OTHER end. At least it's an air-conditioned building you have to walk through but still. Thankfully, an expansion is being planned, hopefully they'll change up the layout in the process of the expansion so walking from one end to the other won't take 30 minutes. 

So after years of being lame in every possible way it's finally worthwhile to shop in this mall again. I can't wait to see what other changes are in store for it.
Big improvement from when I came last year! Great stores, big sales. Can't wait to go back.

Came here during the weekday early evening. Right when I got here, I headed straight for the customer service desk to get a free discount card (get additional discounts to majority of stores at this outlet, as long as you have a triple A card) and then went on my way to shop. 

What I like about this outlet is that it is indoors (with an exception of a few shops outside in the "promenade" area) so no matter what the weather is outside, you can come here to shop and save a lot of coins/ cash on whatever you buy. 

This outlet is pretty similar to the Las Vegas Premium Outlet North, but the South outlet has 10 stores less and the South is all outdoors. 

There is plenty of parking right out front.

Overall, great place to go shopping and very close by the strip.
I was at the Las Vegas South Premium Outlets today. Very disappointed to report that the Corningware Corele Revere store is gone.

First time at the LV outlets! There's two outlet one on the north side and one located in the south! Over the years I've hear that the south was always better and I would have to agree...after looking up what stores where located at each location! I love how it's an indoor outlet! Coming from CA most outlets are outdoors! This place is huge! They offer a lot of retail stores as well but I would have to say the walkways are narrow so if given on a busy day it would seem super crowded! They offer a lot of restaurants in the outlet as well as business on the outer area...the outlet is great place for food!
Love, love this outlet!!  Every time I'm in Vegas, I'm there. It's never too super crowded. The selection of stores and restaurants is excellent. I never leave empty handed.

Super crowded after Christmas, small walkways and lots of people make for a clausterphobic mall. No like.  You can tell this place needs some SERIOUS remodeling. 

The only things that was good were the deals inside some stores.  BUT a lot was picked over. Next time we will go to the North ones.

This place is like my favorite aunt. She may not be the prettiest or richest and she may not even be the best cook, but she's always there for you and sure knows how to make you feel good.

When you show up to her house, make sure you arrive full, because you definitely don't want to eat her cooking. She may have two kitchens, but she doesn't know how to use them. But that's okay because she tries. 

She knows how to get you socks, underwear, and all your wardrobe essentials for cheap. She does have some unusual guests over that harass you while you explore her house (read: crazy kiosk people), but you have to take the good with the bad.

Every now and then she shows up with something really stylish and you wonder, "where did she get that? I want one!" (Usually at Van Heusen, Perry Ellis, or Calvin Klein. Just saying.)

Got a sweet pair of Nike shoes at this outlet. I like this mall because it's indoors and the parking situation is easier. There are more food choices in the foodcourt and more restaurants outside the parking area.
The prices are a little more expensive than the North Outlet but they compliment each other well.

Love love that these stores are located inside with A/C. Such a huge plus when shopping with kids! Great variety of store selections, good discounts, always plenty of parking, food court for when you work up an appetite shopping. This one seems to be less crowded than the North ones too, which is always a plus.

Although I prefer going to the Las Vegas North Premium Oulets, we come here from time to time especially during the warm weather.

The outlet is designed like an indoor mall with stores from end to end. You have several entrances throughout the outlet and a food court in the middle. There are also shops and restaurants surrounding the outlet. 

They have all of the typical outlet stores here like Nike, Adidas, Micheal Kors and other independent stores so you should be able to fulfill your shopping needs.

Nothing like going to an outlet only to hear my cousin say, "I chose the wrong outlet!" Yeupp. The Las Vegas Premium Outlets consist of a North AND a South side so you should check online to see which stores you want to go to in order to choose which outlet you would want. Or go to both. Whichever floats your boat. 

The parking lot for this outlet is HUGE which makes it easy to find a spot.. unless you come here for Black Friday shopping like I did in which case, it was hell.

There are shops inside and there are shops outside. Food court is located right in the middle with a variety of food options so you're sure to find something you like or you can go for Auntie Anne's pretzels that are located at one of the entrances of the mall. Bonus: there's a bathroom area near the food court.

There's not much I can say. I'm not really a shopper so I didn't really get much except a shirt for $10 at the Disney Store outlet. But you know, walk around. Take in the shops. The people. Enjoy the weather.

Decent outlet mall.  The vendors in the middle aggressively trying to sell their items are a bit annoying.  If I want your crappy cell phone case I'll ask for it, otherwise get out of my face! lol  The north location is no different, just hotter since it's outside.  If I had to choose I would probably choose this one due to the air conditioning, but the north location is a little bit nicer with a few higher end stores.

The location is out dated, but the stores are very modern & actually provide a discount. For me, it was well worth it as all the shops I would go to are there like Quicksilver, Zumiez, Pac Sun, Volcom, Hurley, etc.

I could spend all day trying to find deals :) I think it's better then Primm & Barstow.

Things I would rather do than be in a strip mall:

--going to the dentist
--getting kicked in the stomach
--read "FIfty Shades of Gray" (and that's really bad)

Things that would lead me to flee to a strip mall:

--The Strip

Sorry, not a fan of windowless casinos with no signs that hint at time of day/decade or directions (when you're trying to cut through and get hopelessly lost). A Las Vegas conference took me to The Strip, and by day two I felt so smothered by the imitation cultures, I took a 15-minute bus ride to the outlets. Yes, an outlet felt more real to me than The Strip, which has all kinds of meta-irony.

I was also driven by a long denied necessity of buying a new pair of pants, because I had apparently packed on a paunch. Most of the stores were a bust for me, but the standouts were Kitchen Collections (be warned, prices are department store rate not outlet, but a good one-stop shop for gifts), Rack Room Shoes (flats that aren't orthopedic looking, buy one get the second half off), Banana Republic (found my black light-weight pants for $11, what?, as well as work and even night-appropriate pants for $35), and Guess (another lightweight pair of black pants, these linen for $25). The mall appears to be adding more stores

Minimal exciting options at the food court, but a thumbs up for the Dunkin Donuts booth: I ordered an iced coffee and just one munchkin (or whatever they call their donut hole), and the guy said, "oh just give it to her, it's not worth charging." He probably noticed I was sucking in my paunch and felt sorry for me, but that was very sweet.

hmmmmm what can I say about this place. Oh, I know, I wish they had a golf cart to drive to all the great stores that they have in here!

Ok, yes, I don't really like shopping but the company I was with was soooooo into it. We went to every shop and looked and looked and he finally saw what he wanted, a pair of shoes. Ok that's fine but it took him over an hour!!!! I walked outside, he would text me to look at this one, I did. I walked out again and he texted me another, this time with a pic! I dragged myself in and I guess I was literally dragging myself in because the Security started laughing at me and said "that bad huh" I looked at him and smiled and laughed and said that I was trying. He told me "it's usually the guy that looks the way you do" I told I know right, but I really hate shopping

This time I tried staying in and helping him look for those right shoes  but all I did was walk back and forth. Fixed up some shoes people just left behind, so inconsiderate to put it back!! But he did it! He finally found one pair of shoes that he really liked!! I don't know if I did but I did do the whole speel(?) lol how does it fit? Is it right anywhere? Where is your big toe at? Is the sides right? Try and walk around with it? Bend down? Tippy toes like you're reaching for something?  Ok I said it and yes I'm adding this on, I even said "try and fart" LMAO  ok this was the hint that I wanted to go already. 

He said he was glad that I had helped him and I was so glad to be out of the BIG MALL where there are endless stores for shopping and nothing interested me. Thanks for a wonderful with great company who put up with me through it all!

Great outlet mall. Pretty much every store you'd shop at with huge discounts. I went on Valentine's day...oh it was a blessing & a curse. Let me start of with the blessing, tons of additional saving due to holiday weekend. I went to the Coach store and they had 50% off WHOLE store. No exclusions! MK had lots of deals as well. 
As far as the curse. Ppl everywhere. We pulled in with about 4 tour buses following us in. It took us about 30 mins to find a parking spot after circling a few times. The Nike store was a madhouse. Ppl everywhere! Shoes all over the place. No big deals at Nike but addl savings on active wear. After all the shopping we headed to Cheesecake Factory which was a huge mistake because it was Valentines Day. It was about 3pm, we decided to put our names down. It wasnt that bad of a wait approx 25-30 mins. Our waiter was terrific and got us in and out cuz we had to get bk to our hotel for a show later that evening. When in Vegas its always a must to visit the outlet mall. Til next time! I gave 4 stars due to crazy parking situation

The good thing about this mall is that its very close to the airport and the Car rental which is away from the airport is very close to this mall. Compared to North Outlets this mall has more known brands.

The mall is quite good interms of having many shops and you can find lot of brands. The mall is clean and has a decent food court. As we had check out we were chilling at this mall as rental car return was close by, so we also ate here. 

We tried 2 places "Pita's" and "Rocky's Philly". Customer service was great at both places and the owners were very friendly in taking order and telling us about the menu. The cooking and serving areas were quite clean. These places servers Halal meat, except 2 items all the other stuff is halal at both locations just confirm with the staff. They Guys/owner also helped us with showing us how to get to the car rental place. As for the food we ordered Chicken wrap and Philly's cheese steak both were really done nice and tasted quite good.

I'm going out on a limb on this one.  But, out of all the malls that we have in Vegas, this is my favorite one. In fact, I would say that this is one of the best "mall" I have ever been to in my entire life.

Many of you have been to a mall at some point in your life. What I hated most about going to the mall was the fact that everything is overpriced. LVPO-S is basically the same setup as a classic mall, but everything is discounted.  Another great thing about this place is that it has all the good brand name stuff that we go to at a mall for (clothing, jewelry, shoes, and food), and it does not have the "filler stores" (you know what i'm talking about, Shoe Palace, Cellairis, Fanzz etc.)

This time I went to the Skechers store to find some work shoes. Being an outlet store, these stores are somewhat bigger and carry a larger selection than their regular retail outlets. They had the size and model that I wanted that the retail store didn't carry, and they were about 33% cheaper, possibly more. I was satisfied.

A lot of people complain about going to outlet stores because it's not as "new" as the ones in their retail stores. Hey, it's your money and you can buy whatever you see fit for yourself. But for me, I'm not going to be hanging out with Paris Hilton on the weekends or rubbing elbows with the Bieber Fever. Besides, anything you buy new at a regular mall will be "out of style" within a few months. 

I usually shop on Amazon and ebay now, but if I needed to shop for something, and if my computer and cell phone were down, I would go here. Without a doubt. :D
This is a terrible shopping outlet, not much designer stores, very limited.  The inly good thing here is indoor and air conditioned building.

There were a couple of people in my group that wanted to stop by this outlet because they haven't been to this one before. I decided to tag along and kill sometime in between breakfast and gambling and getting my drink on.

On the drive down Vegas blvd, I know we didn't pass through any wormhole or temporal anomaly... but pulling up to the outlet, I could swear the year was some time in the 1980s and some where in the Midwest. I checked the GPS on my phone and I still had signal so we were definitely in at least the 2000s and my GPS told me we were still in Vegas. 

We all get out of the car and the outside pretty much matches the inside. Everything is very old and dated and in some cases pretty sad looking. I am sure it could draw more people with a cheap face lift. The food area is pretty much the same as well. They had a fast food joint called "Chicken Now" which was f'in awesome and made me laugh for like 15 minutes. The place looked like it could be straight out of the movie Napoleon Dynamite like in a stand right next to the chicken farm where Napoleon gets a job. Simply awesome.

The deals are either average or cleverly disguised to make you think you are getting a deal. The only good thing about the place is if you want Vegas gifts to bring home to family/friends, they have a couple of stores here where you can get it cheaper than your hotel gift shop.

I love the variety of stores they have, my only complaint is they really don't have outlet prices unless there is a sale going on. I think this is a set up for tourist because i have went into the regular mall and some of the prices are the same. How can it be the same if one is a discount store. I think they need more variety in food at this outlet both food courts have similar foods you would think with 2 food courts there would be more options to pick from. The stores are always busy, but the nice thing is they keep the shelves stocked. I like this location better than the north location because it's indoors so on hot days you only have to go outside for a few stores but the majority it indoors.

Here are the PROs & CONs of LVPO-South:

PROS:
-Recent makeover helped to roll in a bunch of new outlets.
-Indoor mall with A/C... good for those over 100° days.
-AAA discount for members if you show your card at the concierge.
-FUN carousel for kids to enjoy.
-A decent place to shop for costume ideas or themed-party wear.

CONS:
-While a few outlets offer a good find or two... majority of them still suck.
-Random booths selling useless stuff AND rather quite annoying.
-The food court is abysmal. 

CONVENIENCE: *** [Located at the south end of the strip, easy find, ample parking.]
AMBIANCE: *** [Strangely designed layout, somewhat difficult to hit specific stores.]
SERVICE: *** [Is it me or do the employees seem like they don't enjoy working there.]
PRICE:  $$  [I've found some items under $5-10, tho most items not worth buying.]
OVERALL: *** [3-stars... Sure, I enjoyed the nice makeover of the mall, but honestly coming here is a waste of time.  Better just head to the outdoor LVPO-North.]

Nuff said.

[#24 of 100 YELP CHALLENGE 2013]

Everyone in this store was extremely helpful and kind. I had no idea what I wanted to buy they personally helped me find the perfect bag and wallet set for a great price! 
Thank you so much for your kindness!

100x better than LVPO North.  Love the newer stores they opened outdoors.  I got tons of things on sale here.  Also, I can walk around outside without walking through one huge second hand smoke cloud.  Would most definitely return! :)

This is the worst outlet mall that I have ever visited. The first problem was the distinct lack of air conditioning. Which, logically, resulted in an unpleasant odor throughout the mall. It is also extremely dirty and the bathroom was disgusting. 

It was simply an uncomfortable shopping experience and, although we walked the entire mall and looked in a lot of shops - trying to tackle the items on our list, the only store we purchased from was Hanes (socks and underwear). 

Do not even bother driving there and looking for parking. You are better off going to the outlet mall on Grand Central (which is open air) or Fashion Show (which is clean and has a number of wonderful stores).

Also, has anyone else noticed that the outlet malls do not have that many bargains? You can find the same price on Levi's and Vans at your local Kohl's.

thank you for las vegas premium outlets for upgrading this indoor mall!!! finally the renovations are done and shopping is very convenient now. they have added more stores and there is two foods courts for customers to enjoy!!

What's up with the people who work @ this mall? Besides Renee @ New York and the dressing room attendant guy @ Ralph Lauren; everyone else was snobby, not helpful, not friendly. I understand that most people who shop here are tourists but some like me are locals and if treated well, will return and recommend to others.
Lots of great stores. I brought friends from England here to shop and they had a great time buying stuff. It was on a Wednesday night so it wasn't very busy which was nice!

Maybe I'm just not a sucker for brand names...but I am so not impressed with this place. There are tons of middle of the aisle carts with vendors trying to entice you to buy things.
The only one I may have stopped for is the massage!
I went into the hat store looking for a few special hats, they had one i was looking for, and it seemed over priced, so i didn't buy it.
I also stopped in a kitchen supply store, and it was awesome, but this was the only store that was awesome. If you need anything kitchenesque, this is the place!
Other than that, I left shortly after arriving.

This mall is a little outdated. I'm not exactly sure how long it's been around, but my dad would take my brother and me here when we were kids to go back to school shopping. It must have said a lot about this mall because back then we had no car and had to bus it. It felt like half a world away.

So fast forward to present time. Coincidentally, I work here now and yet I still live half a world away. The mall has changed its name and its look. More shops have opened. As far as outlets go, you'll probably find a store you are looking for. If not, you can drive a couple of blocks down the street to Town Square.

The food options here kind of suck, but if you don't see anything you like, there is a plethora of restaurants to choose from in the same shopping complex. 

Because this is an outlet that is located close to the strip, a lot of people who come here are tourists. Some of the stores are understaffed and the customer service is nothing to rave about unless you go into a store like Coach or Michael Kors.

The parking lot is big, but can sometimes be a nightmare, especially during the holidays. This mall is an indoor mall, which can be a bit of a relief in the summer time. However, some stores are only accessible through the outside and do not connect with the inside of the mall. 

If it's not too hot out, I prefer the North Outlet.

I went to the north premium outlets yesterday and came to this one today. I personally think that the indoor one would be better for the winter. However, the selection here isn't as great as the one at the north premium outlets. There are less stores and less items in each of the stores. There are less people at this one compared to the other one. Even though It is smaller, It is still a great place to shop at and people are very friendly. Definitely worth stopping by if you're near!

Good shopping with good pricing.  

With stores such as Michael Kors, True Religion, Coach and Bose, it's easy to find some cute finds that will fill the trunk. It's conveniently located on Las Vegas Blvd and the 215.  There are tons of tourists that shop here.  I am guilty of taking a cab here before I lived here while staying on the strip.  

The majority of the stores are inside with about a dozen with outside entrances.  There are also several restaurants that line the front of the outlet in front of the parking lot.  

Like I said before, there are tons of tourists as well as locals that shop here.  It's always pretty busy. For this local I'll shop here on occasion to put that smile on my face.  

Happy shopping!

For tourists this place is fine and dandy, there's a good mixture of upscale and regular retail stores which caters to tourists. Lots souvenirs and merchandise emblazoned with the "Las Vegas" logo can be found here at discount prices. 

The facade of this outlet has undergone major renovation and looks great! Shopping outdoors along the Promenade area has been added. Under Armour, Fossil and Coach stores were relocated to larger retail space out here. There are benches and shaded areas where you can just sit out and chill. 

Im not fond of the long and narrow layout of this outlet's indoor area. It can get really packed in and harder to maneuver your way around. That and the long corridor is a pain. If you want to backtrack to another store that's at the other end, better learn how to dodge the kiosks selling snake oil. Some of those salespeople can be really annoying. 

For locals it's A-OK. Back in the day when shopping for back to school clothes for the kids it was cool. They have some good discounts to get you in the door.   Although now  I find most of the retail "outlets" selling in season merchandise at retail price so it's pretty much a waste of time if you are coming here to score a bargain. But if you're looking to refresh that favorite shirt that you got your husband one season ago or silverware or plates that have been discontinued,  you are bound to find it here. Then maybe it's worth your time. Other than that there's nothing really special or spectacular that would draw me to go shopping here any longer.

Yelp 365 challenge: Review 001/365 (8/1/2011)

What I've discovered today at LVPOS:

Rain in Vegas makes a ridiculous amount of people flock to South (instead of the more popular North).

Rain in Vegas makes my cell phone service act up, which in turn makes it a PITA to shop separately from my male friend (who checks out completely different stores than me).

Rain in Vegas makes an outlet shopping experience less than stellar - especially when I can't walk around at my own pace or even use my cell phone!
Got some good deals at this outlet mall. Easier to park there than the North Outlets. I'd recommend checking it out for deals on designer label clothes and shoes.
Great place to stop and rest. Oh, and get some shopping done too.

We always stop here while in vegas to buy gifts for the kids and fam from our vacation.Nothing over the top or fancy here. There a ton of stores to choose from here as with most outlets.I do like the Puma store and it's frequent 50% off sale where I clean up ! Plenty of parking but terrible food choices inside so eat prior unless you love MSG.

This outlet was not what I thought it would be. It was dark inside. Also, the selection of stores was boring. Next time I'm going to the other Premium outlets in Vegas. They have more high end outlet stores in that location.

Ya, this place is older, but I found better deals here than the "Premium" outlet place downtown.  

This is located a few miles South of Mandalay Bay on LVB.  I boarded the deuce bus in front of Bellagio and rode it to the outlet center, then back again.

There's a decent selection of stores here, and the food court options aren't bad either.  The place was packed on the afternoon I visited.

I will certainly find my way back here again.

Not as fancy as the "North" outlet, but it's all inside.
There was an awesome store here 2 years ago where I bought fab shoes & purses, it was no longer there. This mall has lots of shoe stores, but I only found 1 pair of sandals. Not really any "big" anchor stores that would 'draw in the tourists' but it's relatively decent.
Hmmm. Puma and Vans!.....  What can I say Imma shoe freak!

I hate going here. The lighting is terrible and the vendors try to stop you at every turn. 

There's a vans shoe store here. Great deals always empty.

As seen on TV store.

Discount Hot Topic
Didn't really seem that cheap

The kitchen itemy store is ok really cluttered. 

Some designers like Sean Jean 
Calvin Klein, I think I saw Armani exchange.

Not that cheap though :/ 

Skip this one and go downtown. 
You'll be pleased if you do.

I will agree with other posters that the mall is definitely laid out poorly. You end up missing a lot of shops because by the end, you just don't want to walk down all the side paths. It usually is crowded as well and you might as well just accept the fact that you will be parking at the rear of the parking lot and walking. 

Other than that, it's not too bad of a place. It does look a bit rundown, but there are a lot of shops inside. The Nike outlet is great and has great deals, as do a lot of the other stores such as Charlotte Ruse and Rack Room Shoes. 

If you can deal with crowds, I'd recommend checking this mall out.

This outlet lies way south of the strip and is easily accessible by bus if you don't have car.
As for the mall its in decay like many places in Vegas. I got a dimly lit old feel when I walked in.
Plenty of shops to go around but the prices aren't any better from the north branch outlet of this outlet.
Food court is just a ragtag of chain fast food food joints. Nothing special to try here.
If you are looking for outlet prices I would recommend driving all the way down to Primm Valley outlets.
Very nice updates on the stores but is this really an outlet mall or another shopping mall?  Because the prices aren't that low compared to regular malls.  Err?

This shopping center is weird, at first we thought it was a store with random brands and then had to walk to another.  

Ha!  We surprised ourselves!!  This outlet was huge, with okay stores.  Man, i bought this pretty cream colored dress at Charlotte Russe and end up losing it somewhere.  It was all because of the stupid bullshit massage we got from those old china men!!!  Gave us even more pain to our backs and made me lost focus of everything else around me!!  Arghh,  i was so sad.. had to walk my ass all the way back to the areas i was at.  We already made it towards our exit, and thats when i realize something was missing.  Luckily my friend held on to my coach bag, i woulda been even worse!!  Aiyah.. what happens in vegas stays in vegas!!!  

omg, i so hate when people uses that phrase.. ugh.

i had a bad experience here, but i still got to exchange my coach wristlet for an even better one!  *sigh*

Compared to the North Premium Outlets, this place has more of your standard stores you'd find at local malls except it's all indoors.  We walked thru the mall to see what stores are located here but stopped in at the Coach outlet.  
As it was nearing Labor Day, they started some of their sales - 50% off.  
I got a small purse which I was told there were only 2 in the store as they came from the retail store.  It was an off beige/yellow tone purse but you can tell the quality was much better with detail stitching.  Staff was helpful and nice.

Its not the best outlet mall to shop at but its pretty decent. There is alot of parking but when its busy its hard to find. I frequent here only because when friends come to town this is the place they wana shop at. I wish the food court had more options but i guess we cant be to picky lol. Theres quite a few stores i will admit so it takes some time to walk the entire thing unless you know what you need and where you need to go.

Lots of high end stores. There are some deals even by the US dollar and some with the conversion, however, this is more of a place to look than it is to actually buy unless you're really rich. I was impressed by the layout and wish that the one in Richmond, BC had a similar layout. I went to the Hallmark Outlet as I did score some Christmas stuff like nice cards that even with the exchange is a good deal. I sent out a few cards as well to some of my US friends through the hotel that we were staying at.
Not as great as the north las vegas outlet. Only thing they got going for them is when its extremely cold in vegas people tend to go to this one rather than the north side outlet.

it could be upgraded for sure. if it were a
little more functional.. I think it could be a awesome.

parking at this place is tricky.  you park on one end and the mall ends on the total opposite end.  if it circled back,  it'd really be nice.  otherwise, I think
locals and 'immigrated locals' from other cities and states know better to park exactly where they need to be.  

they have decent stores that cater to
different styles and ages.  I usually can find something here if I'm looking for something in particular.. so it's not a total waste of space.. it's also
an outlet so prices can be pretty amazing... if u come at the right time.

Came here directly after flying in from the airport and the cab fare was relatively inexpensive (less than $15). Since I arrived super early on a Saturday, there wasn't much foot traffic to contend with. Lots of stores, but definitely lower end compared to the Las Vegas North Premium Outlets. I liked checking out the kate spade outlet here as well as the Disney outlet. There's also a Ralph Lauren here and a Brooks Brothers outlet for prepsters. It is very easy to get to the Strip from here if you take the SDX bus. The fare is $6 but the credit card swipe wasn't working on the machine at the stop, so be sure to have exact cash as no change is provided. It's 1-1/2 hours from here on the SDX bus to the North outlets. Overall, if you're a tourist and you only have time to visit one outlet mall- I would choose the north over the south!
lots of window and people watching but less deals than a decade ago.  i still go in the am when its less crowded and less hot
Good selection of shops, clean facilities but I am sad that the Dickies store closed.

This place sure has changed, and so much for the better. At the end of the day, it's not as pretty as the north outlets and there's not as many high-end places as at the north outlets. But it's become a much nicer place to shop. And it's indoors, which is nice when it's a particularly hot summer day. I also like that my favorite store, Banana Republic, is easily accessible from the parking lot. No walking through a maze of a mall required. All in all, it's a closer and easier place to shop (and park at) than the north outlets. Though, it lacks some of the "luxury" of the north outlets. But either way, you're gonna score some serious bargains.

This outlet is not bad.  There aren't as many stores as North, or other outlets, but it does the job for general shopping when you're around Las Vegas South.  This is a mostly indoor outlet, in comparison to the North Premium Outlet.  During the Summer, this outlet is the way to go to beat the heat!  There are a few Promenades with stores outdoors, but during the summer heat, we skip those all together.  There's plenty of parking outside.  I heard that we should head to the Customer Service center to get a discount card, but we skipped that.  

Overall, a nice stop before driving home from Las Vegas.  Discounted store with Nevada tax rate makes it better than buying it back home in Los Angeles! Will come back again!

This place wasn't that great, I came here before I went to the premium outlets. I didn't find anything.. I walked out of outlet shopping with NOTHING.. (very odd for me).. The stores are typical and the prices aren't anything of outlet prices.. I wouldn't come back here.

They did have booths in the middle of the mall that sold Vegas souvenirs for a good price.

Nice outlet mall with a variety of stores.  Nike, Under Armour, Coach, Michael Kors, Express, and a whole lot more. Majority of the stores are inside so you won't be sweating while shopping. Nothing out of the ordinary though.
The outlets have a ton of store selection. I wish I had more time to visit each store. I spent most of my time at the Nike store, which I think I needed 1 full day there alone!!

It was my first time in Vegas and I had to check out the shopping. I'm not a huge shopper but I am a huge cheapo so if there's sales I have to check it out. Being that I'm from Hawaii I had to check out what's out there. If you don't know where the Las Vegas South Premium Outlets are, it's on the south end of the Las Vegas Strip. You can't miss it. They're open on Mon-Sat 9-9 and Sun 9-8. Here's a link if you want to check out what stores they have. 

http://www.premiumoutlets.com/

Well I was pretty impress with how big the outlet was. I  mean you're not going to have a problem finding parking. It's everywhere, you might have to walk a little but hey we all need the exercise. I mean they had almost every store I can think of and it's not only the stores I can't really buy from. They have the normal stores lol. I checked out stores like: Nike, Under Armor, Reebok, Quicksilver, pretty much every athletic store you can think of I went in. The food there was good too. 

If you're looking to shop and you don't wanna drive too far from the strip. I'd go here.

Let's go SHOPPING! ^_^  Compared to the Charleston outlets these are more up my alley (read: typical Joe Shmoe) with some haute shops sprinkled in.  Plus it has the Lane Bryant outlet for my fellow big girls!

Indoor mall (not like LV Premium Outlets). Lots of shops and geared more toward locals. Most of the name brands are there. One in particular was very interesting -- Burlington Brands (http://www.burlingtonbrands.com/home.htm). This is like the Ross for the name brands (but very organized and nowhere as messy). Got a good number of items there at really discounted prices. Nice place.

I'm not really impressed with this outlet, especially compared to other ones I've been to. There aren't a lot of good stores, and when I went I didn't find that many deals. If you're coming to shop for designer items then it's worth it, otherwise you're better off shopping somewhere else. So many other malls and shopping centers in Vegas.

Not as many stores as Las Vegas Premium Outlets North, but stilll a great place to shop. Stores are all infoors, so great place to shop when it's either REALLY hot or REALLY cold & raining outside. Located only 3 miles from Mandalay Bay. I'll be back. :)
Great place as it is air conditioned for the hot summer days. It's always fun to have so much to choose from as well as sale prices! Food courts are convenient.
Found some great deals, but then again I am a clearance rack shopper.  Some store were over priced, but I always turn around and walk right back out.
Great mall!  I'm not sure if it is necessarily outlet prices, reduce some maybe, but not outlet prices. There are a good selection of stores.

When I came here every shop had a sale for at least 50% if not more I got some great pants and shirts and they have all my favorite shops. My girlfriend enjoyed it too as they had a lot of the stores she really loves.

Underwhelming for sure. I've been to a number of the Premium Outlets,  this one was not the best I've seen. The north location is better,  with a better selection of stores. But the prices are better than full retail! 

There is a Saks Off Fifth,  but again nothing special. Picked through selection. Prices were just meh. 

I hear there is a new one being opened at the north location in 2015. 

Maybe next year!
I only went looking for the Izod store because there is an Izod sign on the building. But the only Izod is in the Van Heuson store and is just a couple of racks. Waste of time for me.

This used to be called Belz Factory Outlets. Never liked it then, and even with the name change, I'm still not very impressed with the selection of outlet stores at this indoor mall. Most of the stores sell very outdated items, like clothing that was cool in the 90s. If you want a more modern, in-style selection, I'd recommend the Las Vegas Premium Outlets for a more extensive selection of outlet stores with good quality.

Great buys at Ralph Lauren Outlet today... Especially cool, take 30% or 50% off the sale price;~D  the staff here is extremely nice. A shout out to Tatiana, really appreciated her going in back to check for the sizes I wanted. The cashier was extremely helpful too & did a great job suggesting we get on the mailing list for future sales.

The only time I usually stop by here is for a birthday or around Christmas as there's a couple of stores that have those perfect name-brand gifts without the typical name-brand price tag.

I usually limit my time here for two reasons: More often than not, I know exactly what I need and it's sort of dingy.

Every time I've been here it's been very busy - I'm sure it's a tourist hot spot with the deals you can snag.  Still, even with the traffic, it feels like they don't keep it up.  Maybe it's just because it's an old building but everything about it just has a 'please-wipe-me-down-with-a-Lysol-wipe' feel.

I think if they did some renovations - or perhaps simply cleaned - this could actually be a nice little 'mall' since many of the restaurants in front of it are newer and very well-kept.

Will still go back for the deals.

Ever since I've came to Las Vegas back in 2009 I have came here. When I need a new pair of shoes I hit this mall. If you want $39, $49, $59, and all the way up to $129. Whatever you want. I prefer Nike or adidas. Usually grab 2 pairs unless I find some awesome deals I've grabbed up to 4 pairs. 


So if you haven't stopped by your missing out.

Service and prices are excellent. I was assisted by Jose Mejia and he's super. I know Yelp likes some basis for comparisons so I will let you know I was in 3 clothing stores in the Grand Canal shops (Pallazzo-Venetian) the same day and not impressed with anything.

I was happy with the deals I found but like most places you need to watch what you buy. I didn't find shoes that my oldest liked because he is picky and the deals were not that good on the styles he liked. 

The vans store isn't a deal but they always have buy one get one half off. My local store offers this same deal pretty often also. 

I love the DC outlet and the quicksilver outlet. My kids always find stuff and I save tons. 

The fox store has adorable kids stuff and it's a good deal but I can find newer styles the same price on sale other places. 

I hate the Disney store here. It is so disorganized and nothing has a price on it ever. I get so annoyed trying to guess prices but they want you to just grab and buy. They have signs with stupid pricing that makes it seem like everything is cheap but it's not.

now that the remodel is finished, i can give it 4 stars. they have lots of great stores now and still have awesome deals. Go visit the newly remodeled outlets if you haven't seen it since the remodel...so much better now. There are 240 stores now!
Very unexpected help and savings from Michael at the cashier counter! Everyone was very helpful throughout my whole shopping experience!

First of all, I don't like outlets and I am not huge on shopping.  The fact that this place does not get 1 star should be an accomplishment.

There are a good number of stores here and at least it is indoors so we can go during the summer months.  Also, they did just open a Disney Store for the little ones (or maybe it has been there and we just made it that far down).  There are a decent number of chain restaurants in front of this mall like, Buffalo Wild Wings, and Five-Guys so it isn't a total loss.

This in side the building outlet is awesome it's not too crowded and a lot space for parking and since they add up more brand store I even like shopping here more . And we all the store all on sale the price is really a good deal .
I hate this mall. It is a tourist trap, the mall and the parking lot are always crowded, the mall has some sort of artificial smell. Only reason I come here is to go to Adidas.

I been to the North outlet I like this one better because it is more like the mall indoor rather than out door...!
I will be back...!
A decent indoor outlet shopping experience.  They have the basics: Calvin Klein, Adidas, Ann Taylor, and Guess, but I think the selection is better in the North location.

Honestly......   (you know its not amazing when it starts out like that)   I really thought this place would be better.   There is really no flow to the shops inside, I couldnt locate a map to find the few outlets I was there to shop at and its an all out MADHOUSE in there.   It was actually kinda confusing when I got in there and there were just so many people everywhere.  I am fine with navigating through, but when you have to fight shoppers and the kiosk employees trying to shove ecigarettes and hand steamers in your face, its kind of challenging.  The selection of stores were good, but I sensed a common theme of we dont want to help you in the whole outlet center... EXCEPT, the tommy hillfiger store where I was treated like i was being suspected of shoplifting... (i used to work LP before and I know how they do it)   I am not sure if it was just the time that I was there or not, but I guess I will go back because they are the closest option for me outlet shopping wise.    maybe an update coming soon with better results... who knows?

The divier of the 2 Premium Outlets in Las Vegas, although this one has some decent stores too. The good thing about this mall is that it never gets too crowded and parking is rarely a hassle. There are also plenty of great restaurants in the area to eat at if you want to take a break from shopping. It is also the closest outlet mall to the strip if that's where you're staying!

There are 2 outlet centers in Las Vegas, the NORTH and the SOUTH.

I've been to both.  If you're from or familiar with Southern California, to compare I'd say the NORTH is similar to Camarillo or Palm Desert.

The SOUTH is similar to Ontario Mills or The Citadel.

The NORTH is an outdoor shopping area, it has more stores as well as higher end (brand names) stores.  The SOUTH for the most part is an indoor mall, and has a mixture, 'tho if I had to summarize, has more working class type retail stores.

Parking is difficult at the NORTH, they have a parking structure that's covered.   Parking seemed easy over at the SOUTH.

The shopping clientele seems be comprised of more visiting tourists (and foreign ethnic)  at the NORTH and more locals (and urban ethnic) at the SOUTH. 

I like the SOUTH Premium Outlets because it's indoors.  They do have a Hugo Boss, Banana Republic and other stores here, similarly to that of the NORTH outlets too.

The selection isn't as diverse, nor as prestigious as the North Outlets, but I'd say if you have the time to go to both, it's worthwhile.  However, if you only had time to go to one, I'd say the North is a tad better for my purposes.
I really enjoyed this outlet mall. Lots of stores and surrounded by great restaurants. Not too far from the strip and lit dog great deals. Yelp checkin provides a free coupon book!

This outlet sucks. Old and outdated. My local mall is better than this place.

Only thing good at this place is dunkin donuts.

Great prices for items especially for Rockport shoes which I bought.  They have huge discounts but prices still can be high.  I always make a point of going there when I am in Las Vegas.  Last year, my friend and relatives found some items by vendors in the aisles of the mall that were priced as good as Amazon.  As I see a directory at the mall, I snap a photo of it so I can always find a store that i past up but want to go back to.  Now we do not need to drive 30 minutes from Vegas just to get to an outlet mall.
You can get some good deals here. The food court ain't too shabby. The outlet has a lot of good stores. Parking is ample.

I'm just not a fan of malls of any kind, yes I know I'm a girl I should blah blah but I like going knowing what I want and where I want to get it from, came here to visit a friend that works here, it was a big outlet, bigger than the ones in LA that's for sure, it was dull and weird...never been to a mall that has rug...eh?

Nike Outlet!!!! This outlet mall had several stores, but the Nike Outlet is what made me the happiest. 

They had an incredible selection of shoes for amazing prices. The customer service was great as well. 

I found exactly what I was looking for and will definitely be coming back whenever I'm in Vegas. 

You need to come here!

nice indoor mall with much better deals than anywhere else on the strip! i ended up buying 2 cute blouses while my friends bought some watches from fossil & purses from michael kors. the food court was dismal tho & not enough choices for me so decided to wait on eating til we got back to the strip.

I usually shop here during Christmas time since it's not as busy as other malls, but it's a hit or miss.  Sometimes you find what you're looking for and others you don't.  I like that they have better stores now than before.  My daughter loves the carousel so that's a plus since no other malls have that.  Their food court could use some updating.

Since the remodel this place has peaked. Less ghetto-fab, more let's go get some outlet priced Levis. The Nike store is legit, like kid in a candy store legit. I wish I had more time to meander and play, but tight schedules can mess with your shopping. Looking forward to going back when I've got more time to explore. 
It is kind of a looooong mall though. I think I like them stacked, as opposed to the scenic beige mile.
But other than the architecture I've got no complaints.  I think they did a great job and I think it'll be worth the gas to coast the 215 and do some heavy duty shopping.

Old, worn, and tired outlet mall. The only redeeming factor was that the majority was indoors. If you're looking to wander around, beat the heat, and specifically shop outlets, then this is your place. If, however, you shop best in a more updated space, then look elsewhere. 

The customer service ranges from lacking in some stores to aggressive in others, but that can be found anywhere, I suppose. For instance, my friends and I were waiting at the Pandora kiosk with exactly what we wanted in view and the woman never acknowledged us and still was doing opening duties 30 minutes after it should have been opened. Needless to say, she lost an automatic sale. 

There are staple outlet stores (Adidas, Gap, Banana Republic) and some premium like Kate Spade, Coach. The parking is ample. It's location is just south of the strip. If you need a quick supply of clothes or shoes, this will fit the bill.

The word "Premium" shouldn't be used here.  This place is outdated and I really think the selection of stores are boring.  The good news, especially in the summer time is that you have an indoor mall, unlike the North Outlets which has a much better selection of stores, but all outside.  Unless they put some more interesting stores in here, I think I will continue to bypass it.

Good for what I use it for, I'm not a fashionista or a super shopper but this place has got my attention. This isn't a mega super outlet, like the other ones spread across America, but it'll do. The food court is kinda lack luster and could use some chain restaurants. I find my deals here at the Van's outlet, i'm a plus size boy in the shoe dept size 15 0_o. I really like Zumiez, those are the only two shops that carry the shoes i like in my size. In spring time you can really grab some Deals because they have crazy clearance sales. Last year I got me a pair of DC's for $10 :D. The hot topic over there is HUGE and has a monster selection, so when i'm jonesing for a new band shirt i stop by. They have a few other clothing and shoe stores that might tickle your fancy. They have a toy store and other big name stores. Watch out for the Drivers over here, especially the Taxi's because these SOB's are fatal behind the wheel. Also beware of panhandlers and other pests that will try and beg in the parking lot. That aside this is a good place to get some great deals.

There's only so much that you can do at the strip until you're over it. So when you're in the mood to spend money for things and get a bargain at the same time. Do come here.

Let's see,, I bought snowboard pants at Columbia and Amphibian shorts at the Quiksilver shop. All great deals.

Bring comfy sneakers cause this outlet is gigantic. I definitely enjoyed my shopping experience here. Will definitely return again the next time I get a chance.

Thank you so much for reading my review. I hope this helps with your decision making experience. Enjoy your awesome yelptastic day!!

Plenty of parking through out the outlet plaza. But wish the inside looked more appealing to the eye. Looks a little run down and seems as though they only cared about opening the plaza, and didn't care to much about appealing to the eye with the inside design. No big complaints about the outside, which is standard or average looking compared to other outlet plaza's.

The food court could use more big names. We are at fatburger, and didn't mind it cause the employee's were nice and accommodating to my family and I. They allowed us to sample the sauces that would compliment the boneless wings we ordered. We ended up going with the Honey Garlic sauce which was flavorful to be honest. I had a shake, and watched them make it with real ice cream, which is a huge plus in my book.

Definitely won't be coming back to this outlet anytime soon. Sorry guys.

It's an outlet mall...full of stores, some are good, some are not....hadnt been here in 8 years so coming back was an experience...some stores remained from when last here, others have long since gone...its definitely a place to go due to the location and choices for shopping....can get very crowded at times...

Great mall to shop in Las Vegas. Besides the Las Vegas North Premium Outlet, I absolutely love this mall. Shops are inside and deals are great. Stores such as Hurley, Volcom, Quiksilver, Nike, Adidas, Under Armour, Pac Sun, and many other stores. Hours of operation are great and there is a food court.

It had been years since I have been to the Belz Mall, oh sorry the Las Vegas Premium Outlets South.  I was surprised to see the front of the shopping center have a few stores added to the outside to make it feel like the Premium outlets North.  I think those stores should have access to the interior of the mall but what do I know.  

I thought that the mall would have seen some turnover in the shopping space however these stores were the same old tired brands that have been here for at least a decade.  Ok I guess.  I am sure these stores do very well for the tourists that visit and buy an extra suitcase to drag home to their home countries.  I guess I am not a mall shopper by any means.  The mall was very clean and has been updated from my previous visits.  The prices do not seem like outlet prices though I see full price on almost everything and all the stores are priced almost identical you can tell this when you shop the dozen or so shoe stores here. 

The kiosk people could sell more stuff if they would look up from their smart phones and say HI! to someone. Just saying.  Thanks for shopping!

Big mall with lots of stores.  It's kind of dimly lit and a bit depressing though.  The food court also has limited options.  I didn't walk the entire thing but the aesthetic leaves something to be desired.

Why does it smell like vomit in here? Oh wait, it's just the kiosk making buttered popcorn. Ventilation is pretty bad. You get all sorts of funky smells. And the people watching here....oh lordsssss!!!! But you're here to shop....sooooo shop away!

This outlet is alright. I'm mostly here for work attire. New York & Company and Express is where I frequent for my suits and work shirts/dresses. And Charlotte Russe, BCBG and bebe are a few stores I go to for my fashion stores. Not a lot to choose from (personally)....not a lot of other stores I'm interested in. I'm usually in and out pretty quick. Not a fan of spending a day here.

Parking is plentiful so that shouldn't be a problem.

The good thing about this outlet is that for the most part it is indoor.  There are stores where you have to go outside to enter, but those are few.  In the summer months, it is a big plus to shop in air-conditioned outlet.  Nothing special about the stores.  There are the same stores everywhere.

Okay mall. The exterior was updated a few years ago. And the store selection is above average. However, the interior needs to updated asap! It not only looks dated, but it looks and feels dirty. 3 stars for that fact.

Four stars only because they have a couple stores that the North Outlet doesn't have; distance from my house; and my autistic son loves this place and could be entertained for hours just walking up and down the mall over and over again.

This outlet mall is way south of Mandalay Bay. Must take the SDX bus. This outlet mall is mostly indoors which is nice especially when it's really hot in the summer. Lots of restaurants in the parking lot including raising canes and five guys. It is not as big as the north premium outlets

Every time I come to Vegas I go to the South Premium Outlet. I like this one better than the North,  This outlet has indoor stores! Much cooler out of the heat and sun.
There are really good deals! If u have AAA CARD go to customer service and u can get a booklet that will give u more discounts
I like the outlet shopping mall since they have an outrageous selection of shops and clothing!

I didn't know there was a "north" and "south" so hopefully I'm reviewing the right one.

Came here for some shopping, there are stores similar to the outlet mall at Waikele, but this mall is bigger and indoor.

There weren't many stores I wanted to stop in since there are a lot back home. Tried out some places and if you look, you can find good deals.

Some stores that caught my attention:

UnderArmour
Aldo
DKNY
Aerosoles
Disney Outlet
BCBG Factory Outlet
Ann Taylor
Ann Taylor LOFT outlet

---

Parking is spacious and plentiful!!!  Yay.  I like that they open at 9:00.  I think it gets busier later in the day but good thing we went early.  We went right after breakfast and before an intro to lyra class.  

My friend tried to shop at Hugo Boss Outlet for a suit for her husband but it turned out to not be the one he wanted.  So no go on that.  However, the salesperson was super friendly and helpful as she tried to Facetime him to confirm whether the suit was a go or not.

My goal in Vegas for my first trip ever was not to shop but my friend loves Ann Taylor so we went there.  She tried on several suits, found 2 that looked reasonably awesome, but decided not to purchase them.  Happily, she found several tops and one for only $9!!!!  What a deal.  I found 2 cardigans (which makes me happy because I have been searching for colorful cardigans for 2 years now...ones that fit me well), a work dress that's super comfortable, and a lovely necklace from Ann Taylor.  I also picked up a cardigan each for my mom and aunt.

I would come back here, but it wouldn't be top of my list simply because I'm not huge on massive shopping trips when I travel.

This mall has really improved over the 7ish years. It used to be a dump of a few stores only known for the easily accessible restaurants.  2 years ago, it officially became a Premium outlet mall; tons of stores that differ from the North outlets (off of the 15, closer to Fremont St.).  Parking isn't as atrocious as the North mall either.  Great food court and great surrounding sit down restaurants.

There should be requirements to list yourself as an OUTLET mall .. because this place is AS expensive and/or MORE expensive as any other store. I see no good bargains here and I am disappointed Burlington is no longer there :( I went into the Hanes store and met up with a real nice sales gal that helped me get a 10 pack of pantyhose she explained to me that although I am a B or C size - I should get Queen -- they are easier to get on and WAY more comfortable :) so this little tidbit made the whole trip worthwhile ;) It's a good shopping mall but don't expect to find anything at any great savings because you won't.

I've been here way more times than I can count, yet I have still not written a review about it.
