Located on Las Vegas Blvd. and Warm Springs Rd, this outlet is on the south end of town, hence the name. It's an indoor outlet with a few stores outside. Although the facade has been completely redone, the inside is in desperate need of a makeover. It's dark and drab and just plain tired looking. There are 2 food courts and a bunch of stand alone spots to get a snack, like Auntie Anne's pretzels and Cinnabon. There are restaurants that share the same plaza as the outlet, like Outback Steakhouse and Chipotle, if the food court isn't to your liking. Parking is much easier here compared to the North outlet. And the stores here are more of your everyday stores, while the North outlet has higher end brands. This your basic outlet that provides your basic shopping needs. Nothing fancy. 

P.S. Check in and get a free coupon book at guest services located at the food court on the Nike side of the outlet. There are a few good deals in there.

I prefer the South Premium Outlet than the North.
The shopping center has less brands or stores but most of the stores are indoor so when it's windy, too hot or too cold, raining you don't really suffer because of it (few stores have their entrance facing the parking lot like Coach, Gap, Loft, Michael Khors)
I did not want to experience black friday so i swing by later today (i am pretty sure they will extend till tomorrow Monday their " super deal "
Coach offered 70% off on everything and additional 20% on selective items
Gap offered 60% off on everything full price and 50% on reduced items
Banana Republic offered 60% off on everything
Kate Spade offered 70% of most of their product
did not check other stores
Enjoy you shopping!

The outlet is comparable to the livermore outlets as they are not as big as vacaville or gilroy. You can take the bus from the strip to get here. Nothing too amazing and I would not recommend to go out of your way here unless you have lots of time to kill.

This indoor outlet is like a regular mall. However I like the north outlet better. Some stores like Nine West, Coach, and Nike Outlet, offer great deals. Others seem to be regular prices. 

There's a food court, and small snack and other vendors along the walkways. Some of the stores are located outside of the mall as well.

If you need a suit, Perry Ellis at the outlet mall is the place to go. We got ours for less than $178, includes jacket, pant, vest, tie and shirt!!! It's Perry Ellis! What more can you ask for??!!! Awesome customer service from Jaime. She helped us put the whole thing together and she went above and beyond offering the shirt, tie and vest. So with the amazing prices, awesome customer service and clean store... I say this is the best man-shopping I've ever had!

This place can make you a bit claustrophobic, especially if you've frequented the  LV North Premium Outlets. Here's how it sizes up:

-Easier to park (but you might get stuck in some traffic due to lack of stop lights)
-Indoors so you can find some sanctuary for those hot Vegas summers (but it feels kind of claustrophobic inside)
-A lot of store selections (but I feel like the selection is much bigger at the North outlets)
-More food options compared to North outlets, including surrounding food options
-lacks that "touristy" vibe, so less tourists looking lost or toting their luggage

Despite the hassles of the North outlets, I still feel like I'd rather shop there. Although it was nice being indoors, it was easier to get to the main stores we wanted to go to by walking outside the building, but our trip was ultimately a bust.

An older outlet store with an almost Boulevard Mall appeal.  Some higher end shops can be found.  This is a good athletic wear store mall.  Not too out of style but if you want Movado you would have to go to the newer premium outlet store.  This is more accustomed to receive the locals than that other Premium Outlet location though.  Easy parking, easy walk through.  I do not live for consumerist values but none are immune in this country.  With that said this is a favorite mall for my mandatory gift hunting needs.  

The biggest appeal to this outlet used to be the now defunct merry-go-round that my kids used to love.  It sadly has moved on to greener pastures.  You should have seen the tears on my sons face when we learned it has been removed :'( so saddening.  Alas' we had to make a special trip the Circus Circus Adventuredome after that trip..  If I recall correctly there are 2 food court areas with the usual mall fare.  Nothing out of the culinary norm for a mall.  Most stores are discounted at unusually higher percentage.  There are some hold out stores that I would not waste the extra drive to go for.  Mainly the Crocs store (side note: for my kids) and the little bodega type stands are gimmicky rip offs.

Do your research and check if the stores you are looking for are here before coming down.  Not a bad place to shop.  Tourist levels are moderate compared to the newer Premium.  Parking is right in front of the stores and it is easily laid out in a single horizontal grid.  If you're hungry there is a Raising Canes and a Buffalo Wild WIngs in the same parking lot.  Good little outlet.
This is a big mall. Lots of walking and shopping to be done. The mall has a little bit of everything. Went there to shop for hockey jerseys and bought a few other item.
does anybody know where burlington moved to?

This was my first time at this outlet. We were looking for a toiletry bag and decided to come here. We wandered in and out of a few stores. We found a nice option at Vera Bradley but wanted to check a few other stores before deciding. We finally found the perfect bag at Samsonite. With our mission accomplished, we didn't go to any other stores. I like that this is an indoor mall since you can take a break from the hot Vegas weather. I usually shop at the North outlet but would not have any issue returning to this mall.

We live close to the outlets so we find ourselves here every once and awhile.  This place can get packed from all the tourists.  The corridors are very narrow so it feels a little smaller than it really is.  This place is hit and miss when it comes to the prices.  Sometimes you can walk into a store and find some good deals.  We treat this place more like a mall than an outlet center.  It always fun to go walk around and check out the different stores.  The have a big carsoul in it too.  So we always take my daughter for a ride.  This is also a place to walk a few laps if you eat at a restaurant next to it.  If you are in Vegas or if you live here and have visitors then you have to bring to the outlet mall.  Don't get me wrong there are some good deals here.  Cheers!

I use to work at this outlet center a few years ago, and I agree with Misti on her selection of store.   Here's my advice to anyone who goes to the any of the premium outlets, before going to visiting any of these Malls...go to their website, and sign up for one of their coupon books.   The mall management will take a few days to reply back by E-mail, but it will give you a free coupon book for most of the outlet stores, and it doesn't cost anything if you do that, or you can buy one at customer service for 5 or 10 dollars.   
One major suggestion, don't use a Las Vegas address, because they use to give the Las Vegas locals a hard time with this.   On the other hand,  I did it a few months ago, and got the E-mail print out from the mall management, I had no problem getting the coupon booklet without showing any ID to guest services.

.

Local here talking about the one of the Disney Store Outlets in town. As a native Los Angelino and long time Mouse fan, I come with a bit more insight than most on the subject of Disney merchandise at the retail level. This is a good store for locals and visitors alike to get their hands on merchandise not found in any of the Downtown Disney superstores found in Anaheim, CA or Orlando, FL. However, with that in mind, you're not getting anything from Downtown Disney here either. Clever marketing? For a super Disney geek like me, YES!

It's located at the far southern end of the mall so park accordingly or be prepared to walk mall lengths accordingly. Getting a good parking spot is usually a breeze because locals generally don't go to this mall and most visitors are at the other Premium Outlets on Grand Central Parkway and rightfully so since those a touch more inviting.

Staff here are also called Cast Members. So the courtesy and level of service you'd expect at any Disney property can be expected here. They are knowledgeable, helpful and super friendly to a fault. 

The collection of merchandise especially for children was astounding considering the generally small display space that they have to work with. By comparison to the Anaheim's Downtown Disney's layout, the outlet store is less than one general section of the Downtown Disney layout and probably no more than half of that. Yet the selection was amazing by comparison because most of what I saw on display was not available in Downtown Disney. Star Wars products for kids took up only 15 feet of wall space but it was on display from the floor to the ceiling so you got to see a lot more than a couple of racks of clothes or a few shelves of toys. Pajamas, Stormtrooper outfits, light sabers, action figures, lunch pails, backpacks and you're not just getting stuff from the movies: There are products related to the Clone Wars and Rebels animated series here, too! If you want outfit your little Jedi master or Sith lord for Halloween, he or she will show up in style for both trick or treating or parties. The Marvel products filled well over 25 feet of wall space in the same manner and were prominently paraded about the store. The iconic princess products were on full display on the other main wall of this store and equally as impressive. The general floor space paraded a myriad of interesting and very cool products from all the other Disney properties including classics like Mickey, Minnie, and Donald all the way to the presently new properties like Frozen, Maleficent and Big Hero 6. The selection of clothing for adults was modest and may be judged as small by some but it's eclectic and also rare nonetheless. I found a Star War T-shirt my size that I have not seen in any store, Disney or otherwise. The biggest and deepest Disney enthusiast would be very pleased to find new and exciting treasures here. Friends, nerd and geek yourself out!

What's my bottom line? This store is about anything you can't find at a Downtown Disney for the Disney enthusiast. Some may say some items are pricey. I say the rarity in ideas, style and taste justify that and all items are priced properly. The only drawback really is no IMAX but that does not stop me from coming here. The only drawback IMO is floor space. I want more! LOL My actual rating is a solid 5.0 stars...

My family and I are outlet mall veterans. We have been going to so many outlet malls for many years. This one was pretty good all things considered. We bought a lot of stuff at this outlet. 

-Ann Taylor: great selection of clearance especially if you're petite. My sister is one of those 00P girls and it's hard to find clothes that fit her.

-Kate spade: so much stuff here. They were having a cool 60% off plus 20% off on most of the store. I bought a bag for $55 which is super unheard of in Kate spade.

-Columbia: a lot of good stuff here. Especially with sales it's much more affordable and the quality is pretty good. You don't have to sacrifice style here. I got a sweet winter coat for $140 and it normally goes for $299.

There are two food courts. The first one is pretty lackluster. The second one seemed to have better food options. I wouldn't bank on excellent dining experiences here regardless.
We came here on a recommendation on our first day,the sales were amazing, I got almost everything I could of hoped for!

Hey... its convenient and easier to park then the new one near downtown. I think my wife prefers the downtown factory mall but I refuse to fight the horible traffic there and always bring her to this one instead..

If you love last season's fashions and sketchy perfume shops then this is your shopping oasis. 

Wow this place has not changed since I was kid. I used to scarf down Sbarro pizza slices, shop regularly at Hot Topic and laugh at the people who were buying "Big Dog" t-Shirts. Nowadays, I still do all of the above; at the moment I'm wearing a tie-dye Family Guy shirt while sipping some Joe out of my Lamb of God coffee mug. 

A quarter mile of pure international craziness, it's like landing at JFK Airport. This has to be the must stop place in Vegas for people visiting from all over the world with Saturdays and Sundays being the busiest. I was here recently to get some new gym shoes and the Nike store was nuts to butts packed full of multi-lingual people all clamoring for those discounted SBs and Air Max joints. 

Not everything in here is a fake or a bootleg product. There are plenty of legit stores who just need to sell that extra inventory like the aforementioned Nike plus Puma, PacSun, Adidas, Coach, Disney Stores, Under Amour, Converse and my personal favorite, The Kitchen Collection. Which is the only store in this place that sells dope ass kitchenware at outlet prices. Why do I know this, because I love to cook!

** Sip Sip ** Mmmm, this Lamb of God mug makes the coffee taste so delicious. 

I am not knocking this place one bit, great prices on name brand stuff. Shopping here just requires a lot of patience, patience I don't normally have. You really need to psyche yourself up when coming here, trust me, this isn't your daddy's stroll through the mall, this is pure Outlet Mall warfare and with holidays coming up, I advise you to pack a flask just to take the edge off. 

Keep your eyes on the horizon, because your shopping oasis is just beyond Auntie Anne's Soft Pretzels.

Awesome customer service. I wish I got the names of the two sales people helping us because they went out of their way to make it an easy experience. My son has flat feet I asked them if they could help and they went way beyond helping. Very happy with them very nice people keep it up
Good place for summer shopping as half shops are indoor and you can image the hot in las vegas. But less brands and smaller shop scale compare to north one.
Not my favorite of the outlets.. felt like I was at a westfield mall. Nothing too special.

This is really a 3.5 star rating for me. I liked this outlet too. We hit it on our way back to LA. Its right next to Buffalo Bills of teh 15 and easy in and out. That said, it has a large parking lot with no parking issues. It is very nice indoors and not crowded at all. 

We hit Williams Sonoma, Charlotte Russe, Coach, Juicy Couture, Bally, Nike, and Tommy Bahama. Easy to navigate. Good stores. Juicy Couture and Mike were better here than at North.

Came here on 7/5/13. This mall is cramped and decent, at best. Stores are so blah that it's boring to shop there. 

Also, NEW YORK & COMPANY is a joke. Here's why: My gf tried on a few things that when she came out to ask me what I thought, a few employees whispered in each others ears and laughed. It took SOOOO much effort not to say something. Instead, I took the bracelet my gf wanted to buy and put them aside. I WASN'T going to let her spend a penny in that shit-hole. In fact, I wanted to get the clothes she tried on and wipe the floor with them. But I took the high road bc what can I do to those employees who laughed at us? They work at New York & Company making $8.00 an hour. So I ultimately have the last laugh. Losers!

Lots of good shopping and looking at trendy shops. I say 2 food courts ? really...bought a pair of new balance shoes. Great selection of shoes & sizes to choose from. Finding "BIG FOOT" shoes that fit is always a challenge

We have one here in Charlotte, but all the stores are outside, so I was surprised at how it was an inside outlet store.  They had a lot of great stores, I went on a Sunday afternoon before my plane left and it was a great crowd, I really don't like going to the malls because of crowds. I bought a "Mother's Day" pair of Steph Curry's that are back on sale online, but saved $35 with discounts and a pair osh kosh shoes, my experience was  great to say the least.

Great variety of stores and tons of discounts. My only real problem with this outlet is that you are going to be harassed every 20 paces by someone in a kiosk. It makes for an unpleasant experience in an otherwise great outlet mall.
I found great deals here....Yes, yes I had to buy an extra rolling suit case for all the things I needed (wanted) from the mall. I wanted to bring home the GAP, what can I say?

Las Vegas South Premium Outlets is a huge outlet mall where you can find exactly what you're looking for and save some money too. We have been shopping here for years and have saved a sizable chunk of change on clothing, kitchenware, linens, handbags, and more. Here's a sample of what you might save:

* Vanity Fair Outlet: 3 pairs of short for $39.98 each. On sale for $15.99 each. Savings of $71.97!
* The Jockey Store: Multi-pack of underwear for $22.50 each and Silver Line Night Shirt for $30. On sale for $19.98. If you are a Jockey Rewards, you receive store certificates in the mail for your purchases. With $20 in rewards, these were for FREE - savings of $52.50!
* Quiksilver: Shorts for $34.99 each. On sale for $25 each. Savings of $20!
* Van Heusen: Double pleated twill pants for $56 each. On sale for $16.80 each. Savings of $78.40!
* Total savings of $222.87! I love saving money! :)

I really like coming here.  This is the closest thing to a mall on our side of town.  Love the stores, selection can be scarce depending on the time of year you visit. 

DC shoe store, knick knack 99 cent charms, Journeys,  Kitchen Collections are some of the stores I like to check out. 

 I have to say Hot Topic has changed a lot... You can still order Tripp Pants in store but they don't carry them in store any longer.

 I LOVE Auntie Anne's Pretzels.  They have a rewards program & mobile app you get a free pretzel for your birthday & again for the free sign up.  Big food court, Dunkin Donuts & a really nice stand alone places. 

Silk Dermalactive is ultra high end but worth every penny! Excellent skin treatment.  Their profession is removing wrinkles. It will take 20 years off your face.  If you have time you should stop & try the lotion samples. I even liked their Deep Collagen Care mask, removed my black heads after 20 minutes of sitting on my face & wiped it off. It was like magic, my skin is softer too. Also I HIGHLY recommend the Facial Peel, it cleans up Psoriasis, Rosacea, even my SEVERE Eczema on my wrist!! I couldn't believe my eyes when the dead skin came off. No gimmicks, I was a skeptical at first but it WORKS & it's worth the money. This same exact stuff is used in the Bellagio Spa, so you know it's a brand they stand by.


As for families with kids there's honestly not much at all for them.  One Disney store, watch out! Lol

There's always new stores constantly popping up. I like to check out it every so often.

When I got to the airport back home, I realized I forgot to bring a bathing suit. What? No pool time?! I had to do something about it when we landed. Since we rented a car, I realized the Las Vegas South Premium Outlets were close to the airport. We stopped by on Wednesday, May 10th around 5:15pm.

My only mission was to find a bikini, so I only walked into stores which a selection of suits you could see from walking around the mall. I'm tall and on the smaller side, so I was specifically looking for a bikini with ties both on the top and the bottom. I started out at Quicksilver. I didn't like their selection as everything had some kind of pattern I wasn't drawn to. (I like suits on the plain side.) Next up was O'Neill. I found solid colored suits here, but most of the tops only tied around the neck. Not in the back as well. Not wanting to settle, we roamed around some more and found a PacSun. I ended up grabbing a white bikini here for around $50. Tied in the neck and back on the top and on the sides on the bottom. Perfect for me as I didn't need to worry about it fitting perfectly. I could just adjust the ties everywhere.

I've been to the North Outlets before and feel like they have more of a selection. But I'm glad I found what I needed here. And it was super convenient as it was on our way from our car rental to our hotel. In a pinch, this outlet will do. And it won't hurt the pocketbook too much.

Las Vegas South Premium Outlet mall has always been just there for me. What I mean by that is I know it's there but I don't run to them at the thought of wanting to shop. My family was visiting from Minnesota this past weekend and it was my dads goal to hit all the outlets up before returning home. We headed down to this location on his last day and actually ended up with no too much of luck when it came to shopping! 

My little brothers were looking for a few items for the whole back to school shopping thing and specifically with shoes! The NIKE store here actually happens to be a bit better than the South location. Prior to coming to this location we had no luck at the others. Other than this story there really was no saving grace. 

I guess it all comes down to exactly what you may be looking for before deciding to come to shop here. So if you happen to come make sure you put on your handy dandy walking shoes! This mall is never-ending haha! Happy shopping!

Don't go to this outlet now you have to pay $5.00 parking. You go to other outlets they don't charge for parking, you go to outlet malls for good deals not start off your shopping and have to pay for parking only if you live in Vegas you don't have to pay so all the out of town people go to another outlet they have the Las Vegas North outlet it's free parking.

It may look a bit.. uhmmm.. what's the word I'm looking for... ghetto but don't be alarmed by it's exterior. There are actually some decent stores if you walk around. 

It did have a flea market type feel because of the stands throughout selling 99 cents keychains and what not. Good for tourists on a tight budget for souvenirs. 

They do have a fantastic Nike and Adidas original outlet. Nice deals in there. 

Would I come back here? Yea, probably but just to select stores. (And those delicious DOMINO cookies at Great American Cookie!)

I actually like this outlet more than the Premium Outlets- North. 

For one, it's indoors so weather is not the enemy.   

Two, it's less crowded, so no need to maneuver your way through the hordes of people.  

Three, the stores carry more of what I want here. Actually, maybe number 3 might not be a good thing because it means that I spend more money.  

Four, parking is not as painful. You're almost guaranteed to find a parking spot.  

Five, I think more locals come to this one. Probably because they're fed up with parking at the other one.  

So, if you happen to be in Vegas and want another outlet option, give this one a try.
Not so many favorite brands except UA and NB. Actually we just have a 2hr trip there. And I hate the promotion of 'buy one get one % discount', so complicated and have to buy more.....

WOW !!! Good buys abound !!!

My friend Erin and I had a BALL here!!!  Yes it is very 1980's but who CARES?  The prices are a scream!!  Yes there are a few stores that are just "there" basically regular priced stuff - but if you want to do some serious shopping THIS is the place to come!! Liz Claiborne (TWO full shopping bags later!! I really scored here because I was shopping for my Mom - she is a teeny tiny petite woman not to mention a screaming leopard two-piece skirt outfit for me!! Paid 90.00 for both pieces only to find the EXACT same outfit in Canada for 350.00 It was identical !! )  Coach rocks and they are not afraid to mark stuff DOWN either!!  I loved the Rockport store nice shoes for 27.00 (regular 90.00) A very friendly store that has amazing prices in the mall is Fossil !! Bought not one but two bags !! I still use them :)  And a very cool necklace.  I had to make a trip to the car to unload the parcels !! I also found a nice jacket for my Dear Dad and some "kitschy" Vegas souvenirs from the kiosk in the mall.  Its a great mall - not too fancy but has GREAT deals - I mean who really CARES how "up-to-date" a mall "looks"?  I'd rather have lower prices - and REALLY great customer service in all the stores! Besides after you go to your car and "unload" your purchases (in the trunk!!) You can scoot over to Chilis for lunch then go to Saks Fifth Avenue clearance store which is in the same parking lot adjacent to the mall in a little strip itself - still affilliated with the mall itself.  Its a great place and will continue to shop there!!  Its my first STOP !!!
Wird schön angepriesen doch wer in den USA unterwegs ist findet bessere und preiswertere Outlets. Also abwarten und die Zeit in Vegas besser nutzen. Lohnt nicht.
Not the best outlet I ever been to. Choice of stores was ok nothing special and price was ok.

Cool place. Under roof with A/C. In this place that is a must. 
Plenty of stores to choose from. Different places to eat as well. 
Not far from the Las Vegas strip. 
Next time we are in the area we will come back.

This place is so ghetto.  Lots of shady looking people.  Lots of stores that you would find at a lower-level outlet mall including a number of mom & pop store.  Went into the Brooks Brothers outlet, which was one of the worst I've ever seen.  Three salespeople standing around an otherwise empty store talking to each other, no greeting or any offer to help.

The north outlet is a lot better and much more upscale.  Skip this one and go there.

Average outlet mall with a ton of potential

There is no doubt, this place needs a facelift real bad. Management remodeled the exterior a few years ago and it was a massive improvement. Unfortunately the interior does not mirror the exterior at all. The inside is boring and definitely needs a makeover. Lack of atmosphere at an outlet mall may sound like an odd complaint, but cramped walkways and uninspired signage make for a boring shopping experience. 

There are a good number of decent outlets: Nike, Polo, Levis and the like, but there are also plenty of no-name shops full of random junk. Parking is usually a breeze but it does get packed around the holidays. Dining options are limiting to common food court fare, no restaurants at all; you are probably better off going to the eateries right outside of the mall. The outlets are getting better every year and lets hope they do a full redesign and turn this place into a proper shopping mall.

These shops are annexed off to the right side facing the front in the parking lot.

Character Depot (702) 260-8144
Kasper (702) 361-1778 
Nine West (702) 897-7044 
Saks Fifth Avenue Off 5th (702) 263-7692 
Silver Post (702) 227-3005 
Western Barn (702) 260-1888

Pretty big outlet, I didn't buy anything here. There wasn't much to see or find here in my opinion. I saw a lot of little souvenir shops and didn't see many stores that I would like to go to. Just isn't that great of an outlet to me.
This place is so GHETTO! Maybe my standard of shopping is a tad higher but this place was horrible.  If you want to really do some outlet shopping go to the new Premium Outlets 10 minutes away.

The North beats the South in this one. The outlet here is closer to you if you are staying on the south side of the strip but if you can, make the trek up to the North outlets. It has improved a lot since I last came when it was the BELZ outlet center so it's getting there but not up the standards of the north.

The shops are pretty plentiful. Remember to check in at the guest services center for a free coupon box. (Could be handy if you plan on splurging) The whole complex is a mish mosh of stores. Not as high end as the ones in the North but there are some decent ones. There seemed to be a lot of empty shops as well.  Get your walking shoes on because it is one LONG straight path from the top to the bottom. If you want more shopping, there is an outside promenade with some more shops!

So get your shop on. It's aite but if you have the time and the money, I'd hit up the north ones afterwards or instead.

Well no doubt this is the best place i visited so far during my vacation here in Vegas. Now i see a lot you have only given this place 3 stars...but i must tell you i have been to SEVERAL outlet malls across this entire country....and i am telling you this one is one of the best. Now before you all go and say something like WOW...or he is CRAZY....let me just say most outlets i visit are of the PREMIUM variety. However those are not usually affordable despite the fact they are OUTLETS...so being that this one is affordable.... out of the weather elements....and close to the STRIP...it is definitely one of the best i have ever visited.

The uniform sports company is simply outstanding.....and if you are shopping for anything pertaining to your favorite sports team ...this place has no equal. Trust me i am the biggest sports fan there is......and trust me in all my travels across this great land....again there is no sports store of any kind that could compete with these guys. I literally had to leave for a few minutes and gather myself...because i was prepared to spend hundreds of dollars in there....LOL. 

So next time your in Vegas....and your ready to do some shopping PLEASE go to this locale before you go ANYWHERE else.....or you will be SORRY....Eat, Drink, and Be Merry my Friends!!!!

This is a solid 3.5 stars.  I usually frequent the North Las Vegas Premium Outlets and I was pleasantly surprised by my last visit.  They have a lot of the same stores as the North Vegas shops and it is indoor.  What turns me off is the fluorescent lighting and ghetto-look inside.  The outside looks nice but inside looks depressing.  The Nike here I feel is better stocked and less chaotic than the North Vegas outlets.  So is the Coach outlet store.  It was well organized and clean.  I usually hit up the same stores as I do at the North Vegas outlets: Coach, Michael Kors, Nike, Banana Republic, Aldo.  There is a larger Converse outlet here as well... WHOA... I got a new pair of Jack Purcells and some new gray chucks with the buy one get one 50% off deal.  Score.  This trip I also stopped at the Lids store and got a LA Dodgers cap that I feel that I should have just cus.  Only when I am living outside of LA will I wear my Lakers and Dodger gear.  I got a new bag at Coach and got some stuff for my mom there for Mother's Day.  Pretty successful in my opinion.

I remember going to this mall when it was Belz mall. When it was Belz mall it was pretty mediocre, there were some shops I liked but others not so much. I preferred the Premium Outlet Mall in downtown instead although that one is an outdoor mall and I have been there when it was extremely hot and extremely cold and not fun. Anyway just came here for a visit the other day and it has totally changed. I think this outlet center is now owned by the same company as the one in downtown. Anyway, I am from Hawaii and they have all those lovely casual surf brands I dig. Hit up the Volcom store and browsed some of the other stores there. I so totally coming here when I have kids one day. Stocking up on their clothes at the beginning of the school year is my plan. Anyway, I think the mall is improving from when it was Belz mall. I much rather come to this indoor one instead of the one in downtown.

Mmmm, I don't know. The word that keeps popping in my head is "craptastic!" I get weird vibes in the mall and I can't put my finger on it. It feels claustrophobic and outdated. The beige paint is making me crazy. The $13 dole whip in a pineapple just makes me angry. The kiosk people are more aggressive than I'm used to & there is a kiosk selling  sticky balls. Literally. Im referring to those balls that stick to the wall, often found at the prize counter of a children's entertainment center. 

A long time ago this was a local deal shoppers place to find little gems. It's not a total loss, Vans, Levi, Hot Topic & Nike are worth a peruse where you may still find little gems.

Lots and lots of options for store outlets, which is great for those that are shopping fiends.  It's a fair mix of tourists and locals that come here on any given day.  

The restrooms at the south end are the cleanest.  The food courts serve their function. 

It can get very, very crowded, so if you do not like crowds (I don't), make sure to mentally prepare yourself for that (like I do).  

The parking lot is extensive, and it too can get packed, particulary around major holidays.  

All in all, a pretty good outlet mall.

this is not the best Outlet shopping you'll ever experience... .but then again, what is?  it is Outlet shipping after all.....

it has lots of good stores mixed up with a lot of crappy swap meet type stores.  its the mixed bag of outlet malls. 

my mother likes to come here when she visits Vegas (she calls it "Beltz" when it actually was "Belz").  apparently this placed changed from "Belz" to "Premium Outlets -South"
 - this little change confused the crap out of me b/c there are now South and North outlet malls.  

there are 2 food courts, 1 large carousel for the kids, and plenty of opportunity to save money.... check it out, but do not expect "Forum Shops" quality....

I usually visit the outlet mall every time I'm in Vegas.  I prefer the south outlet during the summer months for the inside mall design.  Chicos and Vera Bradley are my absolute stops.  The selection of shops is great and the location and parking are easy with prices that you can afford.
My favorite place to shop while in Vegas. All the stores I need for clothing and shoes. Prices are reasonable too. We plan trips to Vegas just to buy clothes here.
get their $5 coupon good.  lots of valid discounts.

Used to be called LVOC....not the most happening outlets, but I am a low-key, simple gal, and just enjoy the hunt for a bargain. 

Got a few great deals, and purteeee happy to have come upon them too!

Take Deuce to get there; cinch.

Good enough for me....this is not super high end. Warning...

So many things have changed here it's unbelievable! Since the remodel this outlet have had an onslaught of new stores come to the outlet. The revamp has really upped the caliber of this outlet. Stores like Anne Klein, True Religion, Aldo, and more have taken this outlet experience to the max. Honestly, I had all but stopped coming to this outlet unless I wanted to go to Saks off 5th but now I think Premium has given me reason to return here more often. 

I find that this location is easier to navigate than the mixed up jumble of building at the North location. Plus parking at this location tends to be easier... At least in my eyes! It think the caliber of stores have been stepped up to the level of the North but unfortunately it does not eliminate the need to got the North location! (Sad reality is-  North is still larger and offers a great many stores not offered in this outlet.)   

Overall, I think I will be back and I would suggest this place to those who want the outlet experience.

FYI- Outlet shopping is a fine art. The more retail looking an outlet becomes the less outlet it becomes. Additionally, when shopping we'll know brands if you haven't seen the item in stores or catalogs it is a "made for outlet item!" Lastly, always do a quality check on items before purchase, because if it's way cheaper that retail there may be a good reason for it! Happy shopping my Loves! Muah!!

This place has some great shops but the amount of annoying tourists that shop here can be overwhelming. Sometimes there are even lines at kind of normal standard shops which is insane. I've always got what I needed but just be prepared for gnarly parking and an intense vibe

This Outlet has a lot of stores that you can shop at but be ready to walk around a lot! It's really close and right next to the vegas hotels! They also have a Dunkin Doughnut across the plaza from the shopping stores!

Lots and lots of places to spend some money!

It's a giant outlet, located on the south end of the strip. It's indoor, inside of outside like the North end one. 

They've got probably everything you'd want or need.  Prices seem pretty decent.

A couple of decent stores, like Michael Kors, Vera Bradley (which had a great 50%-70% off the entire store sale going on), but other than that, I wish that we had either driven a little further to next outlet mall with Tory Burch and higher end stores, or just not gone at all.  At least we got some really good deals at some other stores that were closing out, but next time, I think we'll skip the Las Vegas Premium outlets.

Surprised the mall didn't suck..
Great vans, Nike, pac sun outlets. 
Halls are narrow and mall poorly designed, so it gets hectic and busy.
These outlets still need work, the outside stores are better than the ones inside but I would say go to the location on the north end of the strip.

This is an enclosed outlet mall. I visited Express & New York and Company. Good deals in each store. The mall is pretty basic and standard. Glad it was enclosed since you can get out the heat. I recommend going to the clearance racks first since you can find deep discounts for merchandise. Parking is easy and simple. Would come back again.

The selection of stores is okay. I came here mainly for the Nike factory outlet. I came out with a Vegas Knights license plate frame from a small hockey shop.

Inside the food court, there was an Easter Bunny that your kids could take pictures with. Unfortunately it did not have any specific hours or days that he was there but I was there on a Thursday.
When I think of Outlet, I think of bargains. Most stores charge the same price as their normal everyday store. It is nice having all the stores in one location, just want deals.

Needed some boots for the Las Vegas Invitational 7s tourney, went to the Nike outlet. Not a bad selection and the service was great. 

id have to go here during the day to see whts it all about rather than at 9am.

I like coming to this outlet. Doesn't seem as busy as the one off of Charleston even though there is a store or two that they don't have. Parking can be a bit crazy but a little walk never stopped me from shopping here.

We finally paid a visit to this outlet after 7 YEARS and its a cool place to pick up some great deals. Its cool that the shops are indoors especially with this nippy weather.

I like going to the Puma store(Puma Suedes) as well as the Adidas Originals (NOT Adidas) store where they carry the old school stuff (Shell toes, Gazelles)  and even the Star Wars line can be found here...on this visit, no finds for me....Oh well, there's always next time....ALOHA!!!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(147/365) "Deal Or No Deal"

Yep now they are getting that renovation that they sorely needed.  It should look like nice when they are done.  I went to a few stores here on my out of town and found some really good bargains...but then again EVERY TIME I come here I find good prices.  This is truly an OUTLET mall not like all the other fake ones out there!

If this mall has a store you like you should check it out because you are likely to get a really good deal.  Whenever I'm in Vegas I try to come by here and do some shopping before heading home.

Nice area different stores and it's in doors which is great for Vegas weather, there was no sales however I did notice that if you go on the weekend you will get more of a deal. Can anyone explain to me why a cup of water is not free on Vegas?? Went to Starbucks and got charge !1.50 for a cup of ice I wanted with my drink!
The only Adidas Originals outlet store in the universe! End of story.

I was first introduced to this mall by friends on a Black Friday a few years back.  Since then I have stopped in at least once a year.  For friends from Phoenix it is about twice as big as the outlets at Anthem and the yet to open Outlets at Westgate, and it is indoors!  While mostly geared towards clothing and accessories there are a few kitchen places and during the holiday season a couple of specialty food stores.  I won't go in to detail about how much money I have spent here over the years. :-)

Wow never have been to an indoor outlet mall before. The aisles are a bit narrow considering the size of the crowds and the close proximity to the airport. My daughter said the Ladies Room smelled and was dirty. The upside to this place has a strong air conditioning system, free wi fi and parking.

While people who have outlet stores near them may grant this venue a star or two less, I (as a person isolated from outlet malls) really appreciate this mall.

It has a lot of stores and kiosks, although not all of the stores you'll find here are true "outlet" stores. The food courts are practically mirror images of each other, with pizza, subs, chinese food and a few other similar fast food spots on each side.

Bring your walking shoes- and don't forget to check out the "Disney" outlet across the street.

A good recommendation for people who travel and visit Las Vegas and is looking for fair price on things to shop for. They have a wide variety of shops from your favorite Michael Kors, Coach, and Fossil. They also have great shoe stores like ALDO, Shoe Rack, and more. If you're also lookign for luggage to purchase last minute and for a decent price, I'd go here. They have a full selection with more than one store to choose from, and they are all at a decent price. You can also expect to find fashion stores for your lovely teenagers and for you youngin's out there looking for a quick go to clubbing outfit like Charlotte Russe, Wet Seal, and Rue 21. You can also find swim shops like PacSun, Rip Curl, Hurley, and more for your last minute swimsuites for the day clubs. They are year round so you'll always find swimsuits. Definitely a great recommendation and a local find if you're looking to shop big without burning a huge hole in your pocket!
Large selection of stores and it's inside unlike the North mall.  Plenty of parking and easy access from the 15.

I didn't care for the outdoor parking.  On a sweltering summer's day I am not too keen on walking around the parking lot looking for my car then suffering 1st degree burns from the hot seat.
It does have some of the brands I like & they are in an A/C enclosed setting so that was a plus.  Now the food court is truly pathetic.  Talk about having to choose from Bad or really bad food.

"I'm from the hood though, like really really really from the hood though."

These outlets are HOOD. How so? It looks like the interior has not been updated since the late 80s/early 90s. But as my momma says, "beggars can't be choosy." In other words: if you're takin yourself to the outlet you can't expect it to be of 5 star caliber aesthetic wise.

I came on black Friday. We got there right before the midnight madness started. Considering the "hoodish"ness of the outlet, there are some nice stores like Ann Taylor, Kenneth Cole, Calvin Klein and Adidas. Not much deals going on there. Taking the less frou frou options, I found my deals at Wet Seal, Hot Topic and the Watch Outlet. I got me two band t-shirts, a girly top, some shorts, and a watch for under $75. Not bad, right?

I still prefer Prim to this location, but I'm not gonna knock this place. Smart shoppers are smart shoppers. If you can't take the heat, then don't go to an outlet!
Lots of stores.  A decent food court.  And many restaurants to choose from in the parking lot.  The Under Armour store is awesome.

This review is for Coach woman's shop
I wanted to buy wallet but there is no price on it so I asked staff was so rude.
so I did not buy anything.
They are just standing and chatting each other and do not help customer at all.
Never buy there again.
What a poor customer service.
She doe not know how to talk to customer!

A place is only good as its bathrooms are clean. That's what I always say. If bathrooms are filth, the place is not worth patronizing. 

Every time I have been here, I will my bladder into expanding itself so I can avoid the restrooms. Today, I could not. The bathroom needed serious attention, and I left the mall shortly thereafter because I felt a film forming on my skin just by being in the place. 

The stores themselves are fine. A lot of them have student discounts (I'm still a student of my 3-years-ago alma mater, don't tell nobody) so be sure to ask if you are a student or a cheater like me.

Although I feel these outlets are a little on the low end, they do have a wide variety of shops.  Levis, Guess, Gap, Coach, Nike...etc......Its a pretty big mall but could use some revamping.  Lots of parking!
I do feel like the prices here are not much of a discount to the original stores.

The mall itself I would call 'hoopty' even my husband commented he felt like he was in a Cancun mall. Anyways what saves this place are specific stores that I personally like, like Coach, Sketchers and Claire's. Sadly I could not find my favorite sunglasses kiosk, looks like they are gone. One problem I found is the temperature. Some parts are cool but others are hot and in the dessert heat that can be troublesome. Also some of the 'outlets' are not really that cheap, you can actually find better deals at Ross or Marshall's.

This mall is huge.  It's been around for almost 20 yrs now and has continued to expand and add stores even through the economic downturn.  We travel to Vegas once a year in December to go to the NFR and do some Christmas shopping. This place is on our list to visit when we do.

The majority of the stores are indoor with a few outdoor stores in the parking lot.  If you plan to shop/browse the entire mall, plan on an all day shopping excursion.  It will take a while to casually go through it all.

If you get hungry, there's a food court in the center of the mall with fast food options or you can dine in some sit-down restaurants in the parking lot.

I've found some great deals at the stores here and if you catch them at the right time you'll the sales/discounts can be huge.  Be prepared for large crowds on the weekends and if you're driving here I recommend parking on the South side of the mall where I've found it to be less busy and easier to park.

Return Factor - 90%

Lots of stores and it was indoors! Most outlet malls are set up like a strip mall but this wasn't. Really good deals, it was clean, no real long lines and not too big or complicated that shopping seemed an overwhelming task.

Not too far from the Strip, it's a long stretch of an outlet with a lot of selection and different varieties of stores. Some a bit more upcaled than others. It's pretty crowded, even on weekdays. A lot of families and people from out of the country come here to find good deals. My parents found a couple. It's better to spend time at this outlet, everyone always leaves with something in hand.

There are basically two Premium Shopping Outlets in Las Vegas: North and South.  This South location is our favorite because it's enclosed with air conditioning and carpeting.  It also has a Food Court to take care of hunger pains and dehydration!  

If you're doing big purchases, go to Customer Service and get a free coupon book for more discounts!  Just check in on your Yelp app or show your AAA membership card! 

This shopping outlet was formerly known as Belz Outlet, or "the one with the carousel".  It's south of The Strip - you can see Mandalay Bay from this Outlet mall!  The layout is like a long rectangle with some add-on businesses at the front.

I usually drop off mom and auntie at the Ann Taylor end (Burlington has been replaced by Columbia), then park the car at the Vanity Fair end. I walk towards Clark's shoes and meet them around there.

Other favorite stores include Disney, Chico's, Crocs, Kipling, and Vera Bradley.  I'm looking forward to returning!

I used to not be a fan when this mall used to be the Las Vegas Outlet Center or even Belz (for those of us Vegas veterans). Ever since it became Premium Outlet it has gotten 10 x better. They added major stores like MK, Guess?, True Religion, and Puma. There really is no need to visit the North outlet unless you need something from Burberry, Tory Burge or Diesel, which is awesome since the parking and convince of this mall is way better. Not only that it is easier access going here for tourists and is also a safer area. This mall in general is a bit more spacious unlike the north which feels crammed. South outlet definitely has a lot going for them, I think the major down fall is the food court options but thankfully Canes, Tropical Smoothie and Chipotle are all located just outside in the front. I definitely come here for my outlet shopping, particularly since I don't regularly shop at those higher end stores.

This is an outlet mall. It's absolutely swarming with tourists. I find the selection of stores far superior to that of the North outlets, but at least at the North you can be outside and not crammed in with everyone. The bonus is that there are two completely separate food courts, so at least some people are spaced out. 

The major con is that there are pagodas all along the center of the walkway, and the people try to put lotions or perfumes on you, clean your shoes or curl your hair. Not my thing at all.

Great stores an great prices. Tbe location is great as well. Lots of food placws near by to eat as well. Going early an on weekdays is best if you dont want a packed store. All in all love the outlets.

This mall is conveniently located in central Las Vegas, but the type of consumers this mall attracts is nothing but tourist.  I also find myself trying to dodge the vendors in the middle aisles (mostly Persian) trying to sell me useless "As Seen On TV" crap.  No, I don't want to buy Botox, iPhone covers, or some other facial cream garbage, so don't ask!!!  Although, they have the Nike store and a few other cool shops, I avoid this place if I can.  The mall standards really need to get rid of the carnival squawking with the middle aisle vendors and you might get more locals!

I generally avoid this place, but I had to stop at the Great American Cookie Company and this was the closest.  

Parking is worse than ever because they're doing some renovation on the entrances and there are areas that are blocked off.  

There seemed to be a lot of tourists shopping which is very good.  Keep it up, Las Vegas visitors.  

I'll only be back here when I really need to get to one of these stores - probably another three years.

You need to go to both north and south outlet malls.  I personally like this outlet mall more because it's not as picked over as more popular north mall and an inside mall.  The Nike store was fully stocked and this outlet has a fully stocked Under Armour store.  The food court is bigger and better here too.  Another tip is the Puma store here has a bunch of Ferrari jackets and accessories.

Though we originally planned to head over to the Premium Outlets, our concierge at the hotel advised us to go here instead.   I did really well at the Nike Store and the Fossil store, but my friend went gangbusters at Nike, Van Heusen, Sketchers, and Calvin Klein.   I would definitely go back, it's a good, solid outlet mall with actual discounted deals.

First time here! Lots of great shops. Keep in mind it's an outlet mall so don't compare to a regular mall store. It's not as nice as the outdoor outlet mall but if you need to get out of the heat for a while, there's lots to see here.

Carousel for kids and a food court. Popcorn stands-that's always a hit with my kids. Toys R Us, Disney Store, Carter's, Charlotte Russe (for cheap, trendy finds) which BTW on this trip they had $5 scarves. 

Some stores didn't offer much of a GREAT selection like BCBG or Banana Republic so I wouldn't come running back to peek into those shops.  If you're looking for kids tennis shoes they have tons of shops for a variety of selection.  

I can't believe it took me this long to get here!  I only saw half the mall but I did see Gap and Michael Kors so dudes I'll be back!

I recently moved to Las Vegas and have visited these outlet malls on multiple occasions. Every time I am more impressed! This is a true outlet mall-  every store has amazing deals! They also offer a very wide variety of different name brand stores as well. 

I would highly recommend this outlet mall to anyone looking for a great deal!

This outlet mall have an abundant amount of stores. The outlet mall is open even until midnight too. These outlets are less than a mile from my house and during the day I do not enjoy shopping here since it is always busy here. Towards the evening time it thins out and a patron may maneuver the way without running into other individuals. The restaurants inside the mall are varied from Chinese to American. I enjoy having a Cinnabon and Starbucks this close to my house in a mall setting. Two of my favorite stores here are Spencer's and Hot Topic and I can find all this and more at the outlets .

What I like about this location is you can escape the Vegas weather! The stores are a bit smaller and I don't find as many sales here as the North outlet. But the parking is much easier and the environment has less traffic. 
They have lots of food and unique vendors. My favorite places in the mall is Toys'R'Us when I need to shop for my nephew's!

Outlet malls are a bit of a disappointment to me. There have been numerous times I have headed to the outlets after shopping at the 'normal' mall, and I've seen the exact same items from the 'normal' mall's stores sale racks at the outlet mall version of the store... This outlet mall in particular is guilty of this... 

Stores like Hot Topic, Aeropostale, Charlotte Russe and Guess are not going to land you any better deals then their locations at Galleria or Fashion Show Mall. However, the Calvin Klein, Vans and Adidas stores have been worth the trip for me in terms of finding killer deals. 

There are many overly pushy people working at kiosks that can be annoying. I have never seen anything at any of the kiosks I've even consider buying. 

The mall has been remodeled recently and it is indoors, which is a big plus when it comes to the hot summer months. The options for eating are very limited, however there are a few eateries outside the mall. 

As other reviewers have mentioned, this mall is pretty poorly laid out. It's basically a long strip mall.  There are stores that are only accessible from outside, and stores that are only accessible from the inside... I find that highly annoying.  

If the weather permits, I absolutely suggest heading to Las Vegas Premium Outlets - North. The layout is better, there are fewer pushy kiosk vendors, and better deals to be found.

There were quite a few stores at this Premium Outlets, but I found the Las Vegas Premium Outlets - North had better stores.  The good thing was that this outlet is close to the hotels on the strip so the taxi fare will only be about $15-18.

The sales were good, but you really had to scan the racks.

It looks tiny from the front door but it's pretty big once you're inside. Huge selection of stores. Be sure that you're actually in an outlet store before purchasing. Many of the stores are just normal retail stores and don't offer much in the way of discounts.

The food court is quite small, I just figured there would be more of a selection. There was construction going on during my visit and they did a great job of keeping things nice and neat.

Just a bad experience overall. This mall tops my "never again list." Confused and obnoxious tourists everywhere. You walk through the mall and get pestered by carny-like kids selling yo-yos and back hair removers.

I love this mall, they have everything and I can get in and out quickly. 

It gets VERY busy on the weekend so I highly suggest going early Saturday morning to catch the best sales and least amount of traffic.

Not much of an outlet type pricing all the stores seem to be a regular mall price with maybe 20% saving and if your lucky 40%.  I only came here for the Michael Kors outlet which was very crowded.  The only sale they had were the clearance purses that nobody wanted & trying to get rid of.  If you want a cute purse you are paying full price.  The people working there are a little pushy and will only offer you a 20% discount if you buy an accessory.  I was not at all impressed with this outlet mall.  Sorry I wasted the $26 plus tip taxi cab ride to this place.

There is a great selection of stores here. It is inside, which can make it incredibly crowded. There are two food court sections. It smells delicious every time you walk by Auntie Anne's or Cinnabon. There are some stores on the outside in the front. You can't access them from inside the main mall, so make sure you check those out. There's plenty of rest rooms and snack/soda machines if you're not wanting something big to eat. Tons of parking and a taxi stand right out front in the middle section of the mall. There are plenty of other restaurants right in front of the mall. This is a great place for locals and tourists alike.

Awesome mall! The customer service folks were super helpful in getting me the discount after I supported Susan G. Komen. It was clean, too. Didn't realize how big it was until I walked my mom around, using her walker. It was too much for her and it didn't help that I went the wrong way, trying to return to the garage.

Always buy my clothes from here when in Vegas. Can't go wrong, lots of choices. Seasonal stuff, so choices will change. Prices a reasonably cheap, but sales tax is 8.25%.  So do the math to see if you are getting a good price versus back home.

It is an ok outlet mall. It has gotten much better over the past few years with their interior and outer remodel.  The stores have improved as well. There used to only be 2 stores I liked there, but now there are dozens I enjoy. 

If you do go, stop by the customer service desk in the food court to pick up a coupon book. They are free if you have an AAA or AARP membership card. Otherwise I think they are $5, but usually worth it.  The staff will let you look at it first to see if the stores you want are in the book.

Choices, choices, choices. Which outlet to visit, which stores to see and what to buy? Especially the latter considering the weight limit most airlines have set. Too bad. Because compared to the Netherlands most (brand) clothes are very cheap. Something to do with your outlets and the currency convertion. But what I like most is that buying something here makes me have something special. The change that anyone else in the office wears the same dress is small (although it happend to me once).

Big note: probably people don't believe it, but I hate shopping. That's why I love the American outlets. One day, twice a year, sneakers and a little endurance and I'm ready for the next season. Everything conveniently located together. And after all those years I exactly know which brands to visit and what sizes to buy. Even without fitting.

In the past years this location looks upgraded. More and more nice stores (Michael Kors, Ralph Lauren) have arrived and they expanded with stores on the outside. Most stores are on the inside (airconditioned!). Not a very attractive environment, but it does the job. And if you're prepared to have a little stroll you can park your car behind the building where there's shade throughout the day. Compared to the north you'll probably find 70-80% the same stores on this location. The other 20-30% are less high end than in the north. Prices between locations may vary to both sides.

Two things I don't like. One is all the people in the middle trying to get your attention to sell you 'as steen on television' stuff. Get a life, stop harassing me. The other is the food court. Nothing fresh. But then again, it's an outlet, not a fine dining location. Although just a soda vending machine would be such an improvement. Shopping makes thirsty.

And excuse any grammar and spelling mistakes. English is not my first language. And if that isn't bad enough, my Apple device keeps changing words into 'proper Dutch'. Yes, you've guessed right, my first language.

A wonderful place to shop. This outlet store has many places to shop from Disney to Hanes to Claire's to Nike. It has many brands and stores for you to choose from. They also have several food courts and their are also restaurants and shops that surround the outlet mall.
Love shopping here when I'm in town. I always find deals!!! I say the earlier you arrive the better if you want a decent parking spot.
Great place to go shopping and looking for some great deals.  They have a lot of good stores and service is great!  Purchased a lot of good quality clothes at a fraction of the regular price.

Formerly Known as Belz Outlet Mall, The Premium Outlets-South is what I Consider to be A Major Tourist Hotspot for Shopping...

Since the Name Change, they have Added a lot more Shops..and I believe there are 3 Food Courts! 

Just a Word of Caution, Beware of those Center Kiosks that Try to lure You into Buying those Deep Sea Lotions, the Compact Steamer, or that Purple Jewelry Cleaner ( which does work, lol). They will Do Anything to Make you stop and buy something from them! 

Parking can be a Huge Problem, but with some Patience...You can find one!  
And, if You don't like what they have in their Food Court, across the Parking Lots are a Bevy of Eateries like Panda Express, Raising Cane's, Five Brother's Burgers & Fries, IHOP! 

You Will Love what this Mall has to Offer...I Never got Disappointed whenever I go there!!

Definite Must for Locals & Tourists Alike! :)

It's a really great place from what you can expect from an OUTLET. Compared to some other outlets and malls I have seen (and I have seen ugly ones), it is pretty decent. If you want to save money, you can't really be picky about how the place looks. Sales are pretty good, especially around the holidays. This place should get better reviews than it has.

This used to be the old Belz Factory Outlets, but will always be Belz to this guy:o) Funny how whenever I finish going on a long run, I find myself in here and walking around. Haha. TONS of stores like Bose, Adidas, Nike, Skechers, Hurley, Quiksilver and the list goes on. There's like five different perfume/cologne stores as well so you'll always smell good:o) On a hot summer day, it's always cool to be in here and check out the latest sales because there's always plenty. Definitely will keep coming back

In TX we have two huge outlet malls next to each other in San Marcos.  One has all the stores you want to go visit, while the other one has ones you just go to because they are there.  Well the South Location is just that "other" location.  If you have time, you can visit both, but if you can only visit one, visit the north side one.
Didn't like it when it was Belz and dont' care for it now, but my mom likes corning ware and her kitchen stuff, so we do that here. Two different food courts. Get samples.

Formerly known as Belz. The newly instituted renovations include: combo carpet/floor inside (don't like this much), larger stores outside front and center, facing Las Vegas Boulevard- Fossil (this one has clothing), Coach, Anne Taylor Loft (yes!!! i love this store), Reebok, Rockport, True Religion, Under Armour, Gap, Michael Kors, and many others- this particular section is very nice (there are numerous benches with canopies to take a break). 

This indoor outlet mall has two food courts (bathrooms inside), a carousel, a customer service desk (get your discount booklet here), and bathrooms in the middle, as well.  The large Nike outlet store (excellent selection of shoes) is on the same side as Burlington Brands (cheap basics for men and women). On the other side, opposite, is the Vanity Fair outlet store (great for undies and bras). All the beach/surf brands are inside too, like Hurley, PacSun, RipCurl, Quiksilver, Billabong (love this store), Element, O'Neill,  & Volcom. A few other stores are worth looking at here too, like Windsor & Esprit (few stores in town). 

The aisles are packed with kiosks (those multi-wrap dresses, the massage group, the flat irons, the fake hair pieces, the miche bags)- get ready for the swapmeet hustle here, folks. During Christmas time, it's awfully hard to walk through here, when there are particularly lots of shoppers. I would suggest coming here pretty early or pretty late during the holidays. 

We go to Premium/North (open-air) quite a bit and on a regular basis, and find lots more deals there, especially at our favorite stores (Fossil/Quiksilver/Banana Republic/Disney/Harry & David just to mention a few stores). So of course, this mall edges out Premium/South. 

Overall, this is a clean mall, with regular maintenance being done (i see cleaning people all the time). I didn't notice any security guards the last few times we came here. There is ample parking space available. The best spots to park are in front of Burlington Brands and the VF outlet store (opposite ends). Also, there is more shopping and restaurants (Chipotle, Samurai Sam's, Tropical Smoothie Cafe, Chili's, and so many others) at two other sections (not attached to the mall). Our most recent visit was two days ago (and we went here the previous week, to check out the shoes at Nike). I'm anticipating the new Banana Republic store's opening November 1st.

We decided between North and South and went with South after looking at the listing.  It's pretty easy to get to rather than deal with downtown.  Also, shops look more affordable than your Gucci and other high end stores.  The place looked pretty decent.  I found the Ralph Lauren Polo store and Brooks Brothers to have really nice deals for Memorial Day.  My mom found a belt at the Banana Republic.  We tried looking for an Eddie Bauer but no luck here.  Interesting stores here with Volcon and other brands which I haven't seen.  It takes a while to walk from one end to another.  Other stores on outside hard to access in this indoor mall.  But, at least it's all indoors and you don't have to battle weather, etc.  

There is an Annex to this outlet which has Disney stuff for real cheap, Saks Off the 5th, and some other local stores.  Other stores are wicked expensive for usual touristy stuff like ponchos and leather goods.  There is a random apparel store with heavily discounted Disney and hats with no logos and T-shirts with some random stuff on it.  I think the store owner got these shirts and stuff for dirt cheap and now off-loading for less than $10.

This outlet mall is at the bottom of the strip, near the rental car center. It used to be called Belz Outlets if I remember correctly. This outlet is ok. It is indoor and has a lot of stores to look at. They even have an Aeropostale and Dickies outlet. They may have a lot of stores, but only a few that I actually browse in. I do like the other outlet mall near downtown more since they have more stores and more stores that i personally shop in. 

This place does have a food court. 

All in all, if you are definitely looking for discounts and/or something in particular, check this place out. If you are on a trip and only have time to hit one outlet mall, I don't suggest it be this one. 

^_^*~

This outlet has come a long way from what I remember it to be from the 90s and even compared to when I first moved to Vegas. They have better stores now (as far as what my family and I are interested in) they've added: Polo Ralph Lauren, Lucky Brand, Coach, Original Adidas Store, Nine West INSIDE the mall itself so that I don't have to toture myself having to walk all the way over to the other one in the freaking heat.

Lately the selection has been a lot better at this outlet than the one on Charleston. But the best part about this outlet is that it's INDOORS! I mean, I love to shop, but that 110 degree weather in the summer is enough to slow my butt down and stop spending money... Maybe that's a good thing?

Another comparison that I noticed with this outlet to the one on Charleston is that there are. Plenty of places to eat. Granted, they may not be well known vendors nor may they be that good but at least when you need to refuel, you have different parts of the mall that you're able to sit down and get your grub on. There happens to be a few well known fast food and sit down restaurants outside of the mall: Raising Canes, Chili's, etc. 

This outlet and the one out at Primm are my favorites.

The End.

So this is my favorite indoor  place to shop in town! I also LOVE town square and Downtown Summerlin, but you can not go wrong with the bargains you're able to find at the Premium Outlet south. I feel like this location is less appreciated than the north one, and if anything it should be vice versa! 
Here's why: 

First, you can come in at any weather type. This is serious - if you live in town or visit here often, you'd know that it becomes borderline IMPOSSIBLE to get out of the house in summer, unless you go underwater! Same for the tough months of December and January, especially when it's super windy. 
Second, they have hidden gems that are exclusive in town, like the Karl Lagerfeld store, a Gymboree outlet store for kids and the coolest toy store I've seen (FunZone Vegas, I've uploaded some photos). 
Third, it's almost never too crowded! Other than Black Friday or thanksgiving weekend, I feel like this one stop shop is great whenever it's too hot or too cold to stay out. Plus I always find the cutest shoes, clothes and gifts here.

Nice, large mall with a great selection.  Some prices are definitely not at outlet prices, so buyer beware! Check Retail Me Not for additional coupon savings! Most of the employees left much to be desired and I  had to question whether or not they actually had a pulse.  Maria at Stride Rite was AWESOME though! Wonderful customer service!  Kiosk employees are pushy and weird. One kiosk employee selling creams, actually stepped in front of my daughter so she could not pass by.  Another kiosk employee selling shoe cleaner wanted to clean my daughter's flip flops.  Frankly, I think he had a foot fetish! The worst employees were the janitorial staff.  Very rude, flirting with customers, swearing, etc.  But I guess that you can only find half witted gang members to work minimum wage.

I just do not like this outlet should not even be called an outlet. Not that many stores, and compared to the other outlets near and around Vegas, I would say pass on this small one and visit the others for sure!
Just a shopping tip from an infamous shopper :)
It's a mall. Don't expect whopping discounts, they are hard to find. Lots of foreigners who will run you over in a second. Walk at your own risk especially at the holidays.

They have a lot of stores that you can shop in but they didn't seem to have crazy sales or deals. There was only a few stores that I felt worth shopping at. It's in doors so you won't be burning hot while you shop!!!

One of our stops to placate the wife whenever we go to Vegas, it's right down the street from the rental car facility in Las Vegas. It's part of the Premium Outlet concept and has several national chains like Coach, Cole Haan, Nike, Adidas, Ann Taylor, Polo Ralph Lauren, etc.

Parking is super easy with drive up parking surrounding the entire mall. The mall is basically one long corridor, with a few small wings. If you check into the center with Yelp, you also get a small coupon book (leaflet) with various discounts throughout the mall.

Prices seem fair , but be forewarned, that as like with most outlet centers, lower quality good may be manufactured specifically for that brands outlet stores.

Despite the 3 star rating, there are many stores in the south outlet which you won't find in the north outlet. Quite frankly, the south outlet I also prefer for the sake of the fact it's an actual interior mall, so there's A/C during the summer heat which Las Vegas experiences like 10 months a year.

Outside all that, however, north outlet has more store variety. I believe south has 140 stores, while north has 150...but it feels like north has a lot more to offer. Nonetheless, some major stores north doesn't have include New Balance, Aerosoles, Naturalizer...oh and south has a significantly better food court than north.

I also don't like the design too much...since it's essentially a giant line from one end to another instead of a circle design that most malls have...it actually takes a long time to walk from one end to another and then walk back.

While I suppose many drive to this outlet mall, it is also easily accessible by transit from The Strip, with a stop in front of the mall parking lot.

I like this mall as it's indoors and is clean. My biggest complaint is that I can only ever find one bathroom and it's at one end of the mall. It's not well marked either. If you don't happen to go down that area you'll never find it. Otherwise I really like this mall. It has better prices than the north mall too and is convenient to the airport.

This outlet is the true meaning of outlet. Junk that can't sell that no one wants. I did, however, find a cheap pair of Adidas sneakers ($26) though. I mean if Wet Seal is still in business selling 12-year-old sized clothes at buy one, get one free, you need to RUN the other direction... OUTLET.

Ok, so this place is not as classy or swanky as its Northern Brother. But does that stop it from having a Brooks Brothers or  Ralph Lauren? Nope they are proudly there, across the hall from each other. Overall this place has all the things an outlet mall should have; Soft Pretzels/A Food Court/ Great Buys/ Foxy Israeli Women selling Dead Sea Products (That's for those of you who don't care about soft pretzels). Plus it is indoors, so it is great for those rainy days or for when the temperature gets above 100. Live it up, you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

Seemed like a lot of stores clean and all inside didn't get to really walk through everything but there seemed to be some good sales. 
Got a great deal on some baby clothes from carriers and a really nice maternity bathing suit from motherhood.
For the Bilabong Store- friendly helpful people, awesome prices, and Daisy rocks! Where's undercover boss? She is happy to be at work and makes people feel good. She embodies bilabong culture.

The mall itself has to take a hit for this one because the small custom tshirt shop called "custom kings LV" doesn't have a yelp.

I had gotten two shirts. $168. The break down being $35 and $20 for the actual shirts. $25 each for the custom designs. THEN, what's not listed is a $25 fee for putting the design on. The one girl told me my second design would be $3 which is the only reason I got a second one. But they don't tell you anything about a $25 fee to put the design on.
So now it's $168 right?? I told the owner that they should explain that. That's not right that they don't tell you that. Also, not honoring what I was told, that my 2nd design would be $3. I swear I rarely ever complain but when I got back to my car- I noticed that the shirts felt like absolute shit. Pure paper. On a shirt. And the designs weren't even straight. I figured with smaller businesses they would want to make sure they made things right with me, but they clearly don't. Please don't go here, anyone. I can't even give the shirt as a gift it's such shitty quality.


Update: the mall did try to reminisce the situation. I just still want to warn everyone to NOT GO TO THIS STAND. They will rip you off. The owner is Israel Hayot and he's a complete smartass.

They use wax paper!! Which you can get at walmart for $10 and iron it on yourself. The quality is not worth the money.

This shopping center has a pretty good store lineup and there are usually some good deals to be found.

Having been to outlet malls in other cities I can say this location is better than most outlets. The location is about 10 minutes from the Strip instead of in the middle of nowhere. It's not a long drive for any local since it's conveniently located near the 215/15. 

There are a lot of stores and here and a large variety of store types. I like to come here for work clothing since they have several stores with good prices on dress pants and blouses (Ann Taylor Loft/Van Heusen). The Clark's store is a favorite since that is my primary shoe brand. It's pretty awesome to get a deal on a brand I was already planning to buy. I also love the Harry & David store for gourmet foods.

Look for Starbucks in one of the middle aisles for caffeine. The food options inside are dismal, but there are some okay food options in the parking lot in front of the mall.

This place can get really busy. I find the mall to be pleasant for an hour or two after opening, but just generally miserable after that time. I would recommend planning out which stores you'll visit and setting time limits to get the heck out of Dodge before all hell breaks loose.

The parking lot can be insane. As a local I can say that I hate even driving by here in the middle of the day during my lunch break. Wow, there is a lot happening here. People jaywalking, tourists making crazy lefts onto Warm Springs (just use the LV Blvd. exit!), and just general chaos. I do occasionally come here on my lunch break, but I park in a secret lot to avoid the chaos. No, I'm not telling where that is or how I get there. :)

Bright shiny colors everywhere but not a good deal anywhere.  I found this to be a serious tourist trap and a bit of a waste of time, but the lady I was with found a couple of things she was happy with.  Standard mall food court.

Honestly my least favorite shopping area in all of Las Vegas. The North Premium Outlets, although much much further from me, is much much better. The South outlet went through renovations 2-3 years ago and it still looks sad and dated. I never look forward to coming here and only do because of convenience. I don't think there's anything "Premium" about this location at all, whereas with the North ones you can literally spend an entire day hopping through each store.

The store selection here isn't as great as the other location but you can occasionally find some good deals on the stores that *are* here. The stores here also have less selection at times even though they have the same exact store at the other outlet (for example, Coach is much bigger at North outlets!). Some positive things about this is that it is close to the south end of the strip if you're staying there and it is also close to quite a few dining options (Black Bear Diner, Cane's, BWW) and also a short driving distance to Town Square which has a theatre, more shopping, and more dining options.

Lastly, this place is indoors, thus making this a nice choice in the summer when it hits 110. But you have been warned... the inside is dreary no matter the time of year.

I came here to shop during Labor day weekend during afternoon and the place was crowded.  First, it was hard to find parking and we had to park on the side of the outlet.  Second, the place was busy with lots of shoppers. There are plenty of shops outside and inside but I was looking for big dog store.  As I was walking around, I've noticed Harry and David closed and Big Dog store closed too.  I was so disappointed that both of my favorite stores closed down so I headed back to the car.
