There were plenty of deals at some of the stores so I didn't feel like buying anything.

The Premium Outlets are huge I think they span a mile long and if you're not careful you can end up spending an entire afternoon shopping and an entire paycheck. The discount stores range from the Nike store they have a fox store Wilsons Leather store Ralph Lauren Adidas, tons of luggage stores, perfume stores and more. I would do a little bit of research and figure out which stores you want to go to and park closest to them since it is so long you can get kind of turned around in the whole place. They have a food court in the middle of everything that has Orange Julius those are my favorite and I love them! A word to the wise if you come on the weekend it's going to be slammed and unless you want to get sold something from the people at the kiosks keep on moving and avoid eye contact :-)

I haven't checked out the other outlet mall in Vegas, but compared to all the other outlet malls I've been to - this is one of the best.  LOVE that it is mostly indoor - although you do have to brave the heat for a few stores that are outside the many wings of the mall.  Otherwise, it's one big line of stores with great deals!  Didn't try any food at the food court(s), but there are more options than at most Premium outlets we've been to.

All in all, a successful and satisfying shopping trip!

Stores that I wanted to shop was not there . Although when I went on a black friday only few people are shopping which I Really like so no hassle in line and I have my space . I bought a shoes in New Balance and they have 40% off entire store plus $10.00 off for the first 100 customer and I am 49th. The employees were very attentive and helpful . And i ask why it seems not busy and its black friday , and they told me that there's another outlet  called las Vegas north premium outlet and more people are going there instead . Maybe  when I Go to Vegas again I surely will be back in this outlet because its not crowded .

It looks like the Las Vegas Outlet underwent a "She's All That" makeover, it even threw away it's former name to have Premium attached to it. Improved exterior design but still retains it's sorta trashy and hollow (but much improved) interior. 

Added store infrastructure and shade on the front upgrade this strip mall from looking like North Las Vegas. It helps that they fronted Michael Kors ,True Religion, and Coach smack dab for everyone to see.  Smart move. Nothing says premium like Coach (jk!) . My biggest compliment has to be the much improved bathrooms. No longer cursed with fluorescent lighting, small space, lack of hand soap, and graffiti! Instead you have soft lighting, black furnishing, new toilets, and a cool hand drying machine. Much of the layout is still the same with all your familiar stores. South-end of the outlet is depressing with kiosks selling useless knick-knacks and LV tees and empty stores. Regardless, the developers and project managers have taken the right steps forward into improving this shit hole. It's a frugal alternative if your wallet cries at Town Square a few blocks north.

Das jetzige Premium Outlet Center, früher mal Belz Factory Outlet, ist leider eine Enttäuschung. Die Auswahl der Geschäfte ist begrenzt und das Ambiente hat sehr stark gelitten im Vergleich zu meinen früheren Erfahrungen hier. Ich nehme an, der inzwischen starke Konkurrenzdruck, durch das Entstehen diverser anderer und modernerer Outlet Malls hier in Las Vegas hat dazu geführt, dass nicht mehr alle Marken hier vertreten sind. Die Preise sind durchschnittlich, das Angebot eher mäßig nach meinem Empfinden, extreme Schnäppchen sind mir nicht ins Auge gefallen, die Ware scheint oftmals B Ware oder Übetbestand aus der letzen Saison zu sein, was für ein solches Outlet auch in Ordnung geht. Der Foodcourt, wovon es zwei gibt, hat die Atmosphäre einer Bahnhofshalle. Wer wenig Zeit hat, sollte sich lieber eines der neueren Outletcenter suchen für seinen oder ihren Konsumrausch.
Most is indoors so good for the hot days. Layout makes the place a little crowded, but has regular selection of "outlet" shops.

I always find something when I come here. Well stocked and has a good mix of high end and regular stores. During the warmer weather the have misters so you won't die in the heat. I like going to Godiva for ice cream...

I wish this had more walking space. I hate feeling crowded and moving for everyone walking by. The stores are decent. I only really checked out NIKE and new balance(which sucks for selection)

I'd say worth the trip if you like other stores, theres other places to shop in vegas.

This outlet mall has gone downhill. They did some upgrades to the outer exterior to have the apply of better outlet stores such as Michael Kors, Coach, Guess, etc., but indoors has a bit of swapmeet feel. Maybe that's too extreme but it's what it feels like to me.

There are so many kiosks down the middle of the mall always bugging you.

So many stores going out of business.

There is one good thing which is the passport. Check into the outlet mall and you get a coupon passport to use.

Very good sales on mother's day sales week. Plus even more sales with our Vip booklet and other printable coupons. Info kiosk sells vip booklet for $5 or print the free vip booklet coupon on their website to get it for free. I prefer north, but this one is good too.

The South Premium outlets are very fun to shop around in and have such a vast variety of shops!! Shops here include: Michael Kors ( which is my favorite!), US Polo Assn. , Coach, toys r us, Levi, Claire's , Men's Warehouse, etc..it's a great experience to talk to eveyone at the kiosks and folks who work in the shops! Prices are great as well! The food court is perfect...it has subway and burger King!! I always love getting a gorgeous handbag for myself at Michael kors then eating a delicious meal at Burger King! Great place to bring the whole family and to treat yourself!

Old, tired, dark...but close to the airport.  The South Premium Outlets reminds me of the older, indoor malls in Buffalo with lotsa kiosks in the middle of the hall.

Again, as with any mall, check out the directory of the stores before you head out there.  Stores sounded promising, but when I actually got there, it's just soo dim inside, it threw me off.

I literally went into 1 store and that was it for me.  No real deals there.

Close to my house so this is the mall I always go to.. good name stores.. just busy and they nees more walking room it gets congested.. maybe get rid of some of the pesky middle sale carts.. ;) always trying stop you to show you crap.. lol over all clean easy access and lots of parking

It was an ok shopping experience nothing really exciting the deals where good went into a lot of store coach, Armani exchange, express etc.. Got a button up at Express but wasn't too into it, food court seems good bathrooms had 3 stalls and yeah other stuff idk I'd say if you're looking for a certain store come here but if you're looking for a shopping experience don't come here

We like this outlet because it's indoors. It gets crowded, but we came early to find good parking. Not a whole bunch of sale after the Memorial Day holiday, but was able to score good boots from Bass for a really cheap price! It's pretty big end to end, so make sure to take a picture of the map. Restrooms are clean and you get $5 if you check in in Yelp!

This is the older of the 2 outlets and it ss more conveniently located for those staying on the Strip, but we find the north outlets to be nicer.  There is lots of parking, but no garage so during the hotter months you have to park in the sun.  Stores are stretched out over a greater distance requiring more walking to get to the few outlets of interest.  We prefer to the north outlets, but occasionally visit these outlets.

The only reason I come to the South location, is that it is indoors lol

i find the selection is better at the North...
not to put the South location down, there are some great stores here, and deals to be had...but i do my Boxing Day shopping at the North location. South is a good way to burn a few hours during the heat of the day...

I took my relatives here yesterday afternoon after they had been out since 10am at other shopping places, including the Forum shops, Miracle Mile, Town Center, and the other premium outlets at Grand Central Parkway. Wow, just reading that last sentence tires me severely, a very blatant example of mall-name-drop histrionics. But yes, a little backgrounder. Whenever my kin come in, it's like a plague of consumer locusts descending upon Lake Commodity. The males stay in the casino while the females conquer...I once called my auntie Jess "Jesus." When she asked me why, I said it's because Uncle always has to throw dice for your clothes. She laughed and caught herself just in time to tell me that I was destined to be a stand-up comedian. In Hell, where people ball up their feces and have impeccable aim.

Anyways, Nuestra Familia had the Shopping offensive playbook synced on their blackberries and iphones, and I was but the hapless driver. As always, conversation turned to how quickly Vegas was developing and the increasing traffic. Being that I'm from SoCal and they NY, I had to do the smile-and-nod routine. The 405 isn't a freeway: it's "parking in groups", right? When we get there after showing off my quick-n-nimble construction-navigation skillz, I asked what more could you possibly find here, there's already too much junk in my trunk? Who else could you possibly buy a "Vegas = Tranny? I'd hit it!" shirt for? But they were Determined.  

I hung out on the benches across from the nondescript food court, texting and checking email while feeling bad for the kids trying to make the mechanical ducks and old-skool coin-op rides actually work. An hour passes by, then another. I'm starting to get hungry. Wtf? Where are they? Is it really THAT interesting? Then my nephew pops out of the Famous Footwear store with two boxes of fresh kicks and the biggest smile on his face. He calls my aunts and cousins, and they meet up with us next to a kiosk (I made eye contact!!!! Noooooo!!!!) vendor. 

Everyone's happy. When everyone's happy, I'm happy. 
Oh yeah, I scored insoles. How Exciting, oh my gawd!

Hence the four stars.
Let's just please not do this again for another year, k?

I wouldn't call this place an outlet - more like a mall with a variety of boutiques and very few actual outlet stores (ex. Michael Kors, Coach). 

As far as I can see, the prices of the boutiques are normal pricing, nothing "outlet" about it. It's just like going to Main Place or Westminster Mall (if you're from OC you would know)... how much cheaper can Charlotte Russe get right??? You can find better quality and deals at Nordstrom Rack.

I go here if I forgot to pack some things; not to shop.

Yea...so uhm if you're into that hippity hop music or looking for dredge...this is the place to be. Eh...but definitely not my style. Once in a while at a random day in a blue moon I walk in here and find absolutely...NOTHING. Then again. I may be just to posh for this place.

***TIP***
Lots of congestion (pedestrians, taxi cabs, vehicles) in the front of the mall, so park on the ends, or drive around BACK to get to the other side.

***PROS***
* Disney Outlet  and Toys R Us Outlet!!!
* Plenty of parking
* Clean mall, smells like buttery popcorn

***CONS***
Needs more signage. No sign showing which end of the mall Disney and Toys R Us are located.

I love these outlets. Randy took me here for my birthday and bought me a new purse for my birthday. My other one was stolen a couple of months ago. I didnt know why we were here, but i started crying when he presented it to me. With all my stress the beginning of the.year and Irs drama, hes been my angel.

Lots of stores, lots of choices.
From luggage, to Brooks Brothers, to underwear, you can find it here.
Good mix of stores, from higher end brands, to random stores.

Parking is good, and plentiful.
It's alright got a few things. Mainly shoes-best shoes discount stores here.

Usually when I'm driving home from Vegas and traffic is backed up, I (like most people) pull over and go shopping. This time I had kids with me in Vegas, so naturally, I had Back to School shopping on my mind. So the day before we left, I hit up Las Vegas Premium Outlets. I outfitted the kids in the cutest outfits for 60-80% off. It may seem weird to have the kids trying on hoodies in 103 degree weather, but for 10 bucks it was worth the "Mom, you are crazy" look. We only covered half of the mall in 2 hours, but had a trunk full, so I considered it a success. I have 2 big problems with this mall, #1 the food courts are filled with crap choices. I'm sorry, but I'm not buying my kids sugar filled drinks, fried foods and lame excuses for "desserts". they basically sell carnival food. #2 A lot of the best stores only have access from the outer edge of the mall, which means no matter what the obscene weather, you have to brace yourself and walk around out there. Yuck.

This is yet another Premium Outlet, from the same chain that have malls all over the country. It has all the big brands like Adidas, Calvin Klein, Columbia, Gap, Guess, Levis, Nike, etc. The place has a good size, it is not too big like other outlet malls, so walking around is more of a pleasant stroll as opposed to a grueling endurance marathon. 

Also, unlike most outlet malls, including the Las Vegas North, this place is an enclosed mall with AC, which is nice, since you are in the middle of the desert. I believe this place is slightly closer to the Strip than the north one.

Very dated shopping mall.  The signs and many of the stores look like them stepped out of the late 80s.  But there are some modern additions like a fancy Nike store.

I am sad to say that my credit card history now has a Hot Topic charge on it.  Found a great deal on a gift for my niece in the "half off lowest clearance price" rack.  But otherwise, the prices were the same as any other Hot Topic store.

I didn't see any really deep discounts in the stores I visited.  I stopped in because I need a few more pairs of socks for my trip.  I walked around to see if anything was worth visiting, but instead I just hopped back on the bus back to my hotel.

The only reason they got 2 stars is because of the few stores that I go to here. I always find a sale or a deal that I wasn't expecting. As for everything else, it's just not good. 

I do not like to go to places that make me feel like a foreigner in my own town. If you pay close attention, all the people around you are speaking another language. The kiosk people basically stalk you and there's always the off chance you will run into a belligerent crackhead screaming in the hallway. This describes my recent experience....

As we were walking toward the kitchen store, we heard a commotion that ended up being a dude that had legit lost his mind. He was yelling at a guy who he didn't know about being touched inappropriately. Somehow his shirt ended up being taken off and the dude was raging mad and pacing back and forth yelling and screaming. I was nervous except that he had so little clothing on that I could tell he had no gun. His body was covered with pock marks and he took his belt off saying that someone was doing heroin behind the dumpsters and he found that belt back there to prove it. After drawing a crowd and a few people recording the fiasco on their iphones, Metro came and carted him away. I wouldn't doubt it being on youtube.com in the near future. 

Locals: avoid if possible, and if you do come here, try not to make a day out of it. Get in, and get out!

I've been here quite a few times. There are lots of good stores, but this isnt the fancy outlet center. There are no fancy stores here at all. This outlet center is for the average shopper. this is the place you go when you need to buy tennis shoes, athletic wear or everyday wear. I've purchased shoes @ Nike, at Famous Footwear (the one where you earn points, etc) They have Reebok, Nike and 2 adidas stores. Nike at least has crappy socks for you to try on shoes b/c lets face it, this is the dessert, odds are we are wearing sandals. Adidas and reebok dont have this unless you specificaly ask for a pair of socks. 

They also have the great kitchen stuff store. I LOVE this store.You always find neat things in here that you didn't even know existed.. and you think to yourself wow, that's something that I need...I've always avoided, this or that b/c I didnt like this or that - but now that I have this gadget, wow I'm going to start eating healthier. Tools that have changed my life:

The apple core-er. Wow. Love it. Got mine for $5 @wal-mart but still..
The orange cutter. wow. Its like a ring you roll over the orange and it cuts the peel off into perfect slices. wow. all I can say.

The ultimate discovery- that i've actually been searching for - forever.. Even Williams Sonoma doesnt carry. The TUNA strainer!. OMG. I finally found it and it even had a magnet on the back to take out the metal lid. Dang, that's exactly why I dont eat tuna b/c I dont like to strain the can, it goes everywhere, and I dont want to pay 2-3 the $ of the can to buy the pouch pre-drained. and that one is usually very dry. This is perfect. 
One day I went out here and found it and got in line, guess what? left my card in a book bag from buying books @ CSN earlier that day

So I went back... guess what? Sold out. arrrghh... 


The only thing I hate is the parking. trying to get in and out of here is annoying. But they have tons of restaurants inside the mall - they have 2 food courts, but they also have a strip of restaurants outside too. Everything u want from Chipotle, MCDonald's, Dickey's BBQ, BWW, La cocina, Outback, dunkin donuts, Weinerschnitzel, did i spell that right?

Now the worst part of this place, which is why they lost another star is the kiosk people. If I dont want to buy anything, I dont want to buy anything. If I dont' stop @ your kiosk, that's b/c I don't have any interest in buying anything from you. Please don't try to hand me free things or put a stupid sticker or stamp on my already done nails (that I do myself for free, thanks). 
 I feel sorry for these folks b/c I know they are only doing their job but... dang. its a lose lose. you dont have this problem when you go the outlets up north - by downtown, and there you will find fancier stores. PACKED @ XMAS. wow. LINES OUT THE DOOR!. 

MY FAV stores here however are:
Nike, Adidas, Famouse Footwear bc/ they sell all diff. shoes and you can earn points toward $10-$15. off. Coach, (those girls are pushy though.. you need't tell me how much everything costs when I pick it up) Guess, VF (for undergarments, Maidenform, and Bally. bras for $15!. You can't beat it!

I have been to these outlets ever since they were called Belz and as a matter of fact I still call them that to this day. But anyways onto what I think about this outlet mall. First of all, I have seen it grow into a pretty diverse compilation of stores over the years. It really does have a variety of shops to choose from and if your looking for something the chances are good that you'll find it here.

There are a few cons about this outlet mall though. What bothers me the most is that it always seems that I have horrible internet connection while inside. I wish someday they could correct this or at least provide a free wifi service inside this outlet like a lot of places do these days. Also, I hope someday they can provide a better selection of eateries inside the food courts. I don't remember the last time I even got anything to eat inside and I've been here plenty of times. We opt just to eat right outside the outlets as there are plenty of better options including restaurants to choose from.

This place is monstrous.  Reminded me of the Camarillo Outlets in California. This is a great outlet mall.  Yes, the typical stores.  But so many more that you can definitely find bargains.  I went to the Van Heusen store and got me a couple of pairs of very nice shorts for the summer for 1/3 the price of the shorts at Nike.  Yes, both are nice and Nike makes a great product, but so does Van Heusen.

I went during a weekday and it wasn't too crowded.  I guess if I went on a weekend it would be packed.  If you haven't been here, or been here in a while, check it out.  Good stuff here.

This place was never a good mall to begin with, and with Music 4 Less and Flashbacks closing down, it has been dealt even more fatal blows.

Pretty much all that is left in this place now is clothing stores. Yes, i know that's probably why most of you come to this place in the first place, but those of us who desire something more out of our mall experience will be sorely disappointed. 

The layout of the mall is very strange as well. It is a "comb" shape, basically a straight line with extensions to the exits. It gets annoying having to divert from the central hall just to go down each of the "teeth" to see what is there. And why does the place have TWO FOOD COURTS? This is a really strange move, they would have been better off having just one big one, and a nice, two-story layout that took up less space. 

The parking lot here is a zoo as well. Apparently, this is a popular tourist attraction (I can confirm that having worked in one of the stores some years back.) You're not going to have an easy time finding a close space. My advice - if you come, park outside Burlington's on the north end, there seem to be more spaces there than you might think, and apparently not many people think to park there.

If you're in the area and want to do some clothing shopping (and not much else), stop on in. But don't go out of your way to visit this place by any means.

Just south of Mandalay Bay and away from the busy Las Vegas Strip, Las Vegas South Premium Outlets delivers significant discounts on popular brands. Shoppers of all ages will find deals for everyone.

Few of many are Neiman Marcus Last Call and Williams Sonoma Outlet. Both stores carry items that were actually in the original stores and not made specifically for the outlets. 

Jerky outlet a plus, but was dissatisfied as they don't seem to offer any discounted prices. Found that to be true with other shops within this mall. 

However, went into Foot Locker & happened upon a clearance pair of Under Amour shoes which were marked down & then half off that price. " what a steal"!   

The Las Vegas South Premium Outlets offer plenty of food court options too!

BTW: there is a NORTH & South Premium  Outlet in Vegas. South is indoors and air conditioned where the other is outdoors. They have many similar stores in which case check around & shop to see which location has the better deals on the day you go!

Honestly, the only thing that REALLY kills the great shopping experience that you could have here is the numerous kiosks lined up in the middle with obnoxious sales people coming up in your face, trying to find a way for you to come and buy their overpriced product. Normally there's enough space for you to keep your distance and avoid them if you're not interested but there isn't enough space since their kiosk is right in the middle of the already narrow walkway. 
In addition to that, my little sister was persuaded to try getting her eyebrows threaded by one of the kiosks and the girl was telling us how she had years of experience and what not. My little sister said the lady's technique was ten times more painful than her first experience with threading and her eye brows were not even even and she had made one eyebrow noticeably thinner than the other. Definitely not going back to this mall next time I'm in Vegas!

This outlet has potential.

But in order for that to happen, a facelift needs to happen with the interior. They did a good job in reconstructing the exterior to look more modern and to match more like its sister North site but the inside lacks character and energy. It's almost sad.

The stores within the mall are getting better but not as good at the North location. This is the only reason I'd visit if I'm not in the mood to travel far for a specific item I need. The Nike Outlet, Pac Sun and Zumiez are my top stores here since I tend to be at the Fashion Show Mall with their options (Topshop, Zara; etc) but you can really find something here for a good deal. I'm never here to kill time though. The atmosphere isn't my favorite and I'm almost always needing a cup of coffee as I'm leaving.

It'll be cool if they gutted the tiles, added skylights throughout to have more natural light inside, and create a more chic and modern environment that makes it enjoyable. In a city that's always changing, this mall deserves to change for the better since it's already on The Strip. Then it'll flourish.

I've been coming here since I was a kid and it is definitely not my favorite LV outlet, it's run down and the last time I was there is was getting a much needed overhaul. Because Nike is there I'll still stop here but it's only for Nike and then it's time to get back to doing other things. When we plan out the day of shopping in Vegas we will plan to get to the other outlet, the outdoor one when the weather is best. Once it's hot as balls outside we will stop in here to cool off in NIke and blow a few bucks and once we stop sweating in the summer or freezing from the winter we leave. 
Honestly the weather in Vegas sucks. No idea who wants to live there. I'll stick to visiting.

During the summer and winter months, when outdoor malls can be unbearable due to the weather, this mostly-enclosed outlet mall is an oasis.  They expanded their store mix by adding merchants along the outside of the mall.  It looks very different from the first time I visited in 2005.  Although there are only a few stores that I actually shop in (that's the way it is for me in every outlet mall), I find it worth visiting here because of the climate control, usually-sufficient parking, and good selection of restaurants both inside and along the outer edges of their parking lot.

Guest services don't have their policies together. They will ask to hold your state I.d. So I asked if you are shopping and using your credit card they will ask for your credit card. The black lady said just tell them guest services have it. So my brother let them hold his I.d. When I went shopping I explained to an employee at the store if I'm charging will I need my state I.d. she said "yes". So if I gave my I.d. and I went shopping and they needed to verify my name with my credit card I would have to return back the wheel chair we rented for my mom. I don't recommend coming here if you need to rent a wheel chair. Zero stars but was forced to give 1 star.

I love the outlet mall. It's a good enough size, not too small and not too big. It has a great variety of stores. They also have amazing deals going on at the stores. The people there are also very nice!
I found this to be an amazing outlet. Visiting Las Vegas and wanted to do some shopping. For military, most stores offer discounts with military ID. I'll go back again.

This isn't really a premium outlet but you still get good prices for the stuff here. There are a few high-end stores but it's mostly middle-class stores. This place is getting bigger every day. They are adding more shops with more restaurants in here. It's actually a pretty crowded place on Sundays right before everyone heads back to California. It is indoors so it's definitely better than the north outlets in that way. I do stop by if I need to kill time but it's not on my list of "must visits" like the north Las Vegas outlets.

If you want the AC while shopping outlets, you'd want to stop by here!
Sucks. Prices are ok but not the quality. Far away from strip. Allot junk in general . Would not go again

It seems over the  last few days I've been here quite a bit and have probably spent way too much money. But I've gotten some really good deals.  And two of my kids work here. 
It's also a really good place to walk out of the heat and get some exercise. 
Good restaurants in front of it.

I did 90% of my shopping from this mall. It had a wide range of outlet stores to choose from and it was easy to get around. What was also awesome is the parking stall indicator. If there was a parked call, it would have a red light above the stall. If it was empty, the light would be green. Very, very helpful when looking for parking.

Premium Outlets South is the indoor mall. This was a good thing since the day we went, it was storming. I still prefer the North as it's almost double the size. Ann Taylor, Nike, Hush Puppies, Lane Bryant, Hot Topic, and Sean John were some of the stores that I'd seen. This mall is definitely long. I felt like I was walking forever. Along the way, we saw two food courts. 

I didn't find the prices at the outlets here to be much cheaper than the regular retail stores. I live in Hawaii and the prices here were comparable to home. I didn't end up buying anything. I wasn't about to buy something that was a dollar or two cheaper to lug it home.

If you check in on your Yelp app you get the free coupon book which usually costs $10. The lady working behind the counter said that I was the first person she encountered who did this. She'd never seen the check in before and didn't know about it. She just gave me the book anyway.

I came in shopping for shoes and found everything I could want here. The mall and floors are clean. There is literally almost nothing you can't get or find here. 

Also if you're in here and need a phone case try "Case Yard". They offer hand crafted wood phone cases for iPhone 5 and 6 plus models included. Beautiful cases.
Love the new O'neill store!!! The remodel looks good!!!

There really isn't much to complain about this outlet mall. In the dead of summer, what other location is going to offer free AC and miles of different stores for my browsing?!

I enjoyed this location much better than the North location. It is an all indoor outlet which entails a lot of different stores. Yes, some of the stores seem outdated and could use a makeover or switch out of more popular ones but it will do for now.

They have a couple of food courts which provides a good variety of food options. Don't forget those little shops in the center that sell specialty popcorn or pretzels. It's a great place to cool down, window shop, eating and calorie burn.

The prices are definitely not that discounted though they make it sound like you're getting mad deals. If you go to enough outlets you will know that most of them don't really give that much of a discount. All they do is jack up the price and say buy on get one free. Don't think for a second you are in the win lol

My tip to surviving hot weather is to go into an air-conditioned environment and hibernate. Each day that I was in Las Vegas in July, the temperature was at least 110°F. 

My friend and I enjoy shopping. This outlet mall was close to our hotel. We decided to drive over there and beat the oppressive heat.

I love this mall. It has my main stores that keep me happy, such as Gap Factory, Skechers, and Fossil. I also discovered new stores that I love, like Kipling.

For years, I have wanted something with a cute dangling gorilla. I couldn't afford anything until I found this Kipling store. I could buy a wallet and a pencil case at great prices. Back then, I wasn't interested in getting a purse from this store. Perhaps the next time that I am back, I will get one. I have had both items since July 2015, and they work and look great to this day.

My friend and I tore up the Gap Factory store. I have not purchased anything from a typical mall Gap store in years. Rather, a lot of my wardrobe comes from the factory store. You get huge discounts and you look great. 

We both bought so much stuff at the Gap store that we had to brave the heat to put all our goodies in my steaming car rental's trunk. It was worth not lugging everything around for hours.

We did a couple of breaks at Starbucks. We made sure that we were hydrated with beverages and I had a sugar cookie the second time.

I love this mall. It is huge, so you can easily spend hours here. The prices are great and it's always satisfying to get what you want at a discount.

(178)

Depending on your style or clothing preference, this outlet may be or may not be for you.  If you're more in to the higher type class clothing I suggest you head out to the premium outlet near downtown vegas but if you're in to surfing brands, good kicks, and skinny jeans, this place is for you.

Levis is always having great discounts on their jeans so before you go paying for it full priced at the near by Town Square, this place is just about 5 min drive away and if you want to save, why not check it out.

Quicksilver, Hurley, Billabong, and even Oneil are all here, so duuude come on braaaah, check these places out for totally awesome sales duuude.  

Now for the kicks....Nike, Adidas, Converse and other great brand names are here too.  Im not really knowledgeable when it comes to how much these shoes should be compared to whats out there because all I buy are chucks so I can't really tell you whether the deals here are great or not.  

This place isn't as nice or as big as the Premium but its really close to where I live and has all the stores I prefer and this is the reason for my 4 star.

This outlet was situated right close by my hotel off the strip.  I got almost every single souvenier that I needed to get here, as they've got some great deals on T-shirts.

It's laid out in one huge strip (not ideal if you want to cover a lot of ground in a short period of time), but they've got a decent selection of stores, and it's all indoors.

The food court selection isn't great, and even though they have a huge selection of restaurants directly in front of the mall, they are all chains.  Kinda dissapointing, but I guess that's what you expect to see at any mall in america.

Looking for bargains in Vegas?  Don't go to the Strip, with its skeevy souvenir stores and pricey casino malls.  Instead, head over to the Las Vegas Outlet Mall, where you can actually get something for your money besides the thrill of plunking it into a one-armed bandit.

This outlet mall is huge, and it just goes on and on...and on.  And on.  It's so big that there are two food courts, and one of them is located next to a carousel.  Yes, there is a somewhat random feel to the layout and selection of stores, but it's such a diverse mix that there will be something for everyone in your group to browse through - though you might have some trouble meeting up again later.

Some of my favorite stores include the Fossil outlet, which has tables of $20 and $30 watches (but make sure they check the battery before you leave); Charlotte Russe, which has a fun mix of funky and bohemian women's clothes, and a giant clearance rack in the back (I got a super-cute skirt there for $8 that I wear all the time); Vans, which has styles you won't see in regular stores and a big sale section; and Levi's, where you can get irregulars for half the price of normal Levi's.

Other notable stores include Liz Claiborne, Jones New York, Nike, Reebok, and Tommy Hilfiger.  Shoe lovers will find Adidas, Bass, Skechers, and Naturalizers, among others.  There are home furnishings stores (Mikasa, Black & Decker), leather stores (Wilson, and, soon, Coach), and gourmet foods (Harry & David, Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory).  

As with any "outlet" mall, there are some stores that seem suspiciously non-outlet, and some weird stores that are just oddball (like the rocks 'n' geodes shop).  Plan to spend at least an afternoon here, particularly if you're hiding out from the intense Vegas heat.  You may spend more than you planned - I always do - but unlike at the casinos, at least you'll have something to show for it when you head back home.

If you dont like fighting the crowd and an indoor shopping experience, this is the place to go. Other wise, this place sucks.  I'd rather go to the Premium outlets on the North end of LV. The selection at this outlet sucks, but I hear that change is on the way with some new anchor stores. BUT then again, thats what Obama promised the people, change...the kind thats in your pocket (shameless political jab)  I really didn't like this outlet, probably one of the "bottom 5" outlets I've been to.

Here's my suggested itinerary for the Las Vegas Outlet Center: Park at Burlington Brands and enter this wonderland of cheapness. Okay, so they're not stocking Vogue fashion here. However, they are stocking plenty of solid colored knits for $10 and under, and some crazy $3 ties. It's worth a looksie. Then, head straight. Watch out for the kiosk hucksters or you may end up with Dead Sea Salts, a smokeless cigarette, some jewelry cleaner and a knockoff Sham-Wow. Stop by Calvin Klein and head to the back where they generally have a good selection of an additional 50-70% off items. Next stop, Vans. The store is much bigger than the Premium Outlet location. While you're in skater mode, visit Hurley. They have some cute stuff for the ladies, and if you are in complete teen angst you can check out Hot Topic. (They have some unique accessory options, like glittery fishnet stockings.) Always stop by the classic Adidas store. Good finds have included a Def Jams track suit and a stash of Star Wars collectibles. Yoda tennis shoes anyone? If you're in the market for "come hither" heels or just shoes, Closet has a pretty good selection if you don't mind wearing Carlos, Jessica or Fergie! And for the grand finale, explore hair options at the wig shop. You'll have to invest $6 for a wig cap to try on a full wig, but it's worth the investment if you are considering a color or cut change! (I personally learned I would make a hideous blonde!) They also have a good selection of extensions and smaller hair additions. If you've still got juice, you can head over to Off Saks. Otherwise, call it a day and come back soon as it looks like the place is undergoing a face lift. I admit I'll miss the neon. Generally, I am a fan of any place where I can find a deal, but the interior isn't too snazzy (maybe that will change with the facelift), and the snack options aren't too tasty.
Well all I really have to say about this outlet versus the north one. Less high end shops but it's inside which is nice during the summer.

I'm not much of a shopper but whenever I'm in Vegas & in the mood for shopping this is the place for me! There's a photography shop, lots of shoe stores to satisfy this shoe fiend & usually find great deals on clothes. 

The outlet is currently under construction which makes it a bit inconvenient to enter the mall.

Like everyone has said, not a great outlet but will do.  If you have limited time to shop while in Vegas I would suggest going to the North Outlet over this one.  If you're from the bay area its very much similar to the Great Mall but crappier.

The ONLY reason I would come here is for the Nike Outlet.  Skip everything else inside.

While in town hopped the bus down to this mall, and I can say it as a waste of time.  Walked end to end nothing caught our interesting, and the food court was not very inviting ether, we left with nothing and have never been back.

No different than any outlet malls across the nation. Most of the store were located indoor with excellent AC. A good selection of big name stores and fast food eateries. Lots of kiosks with annoying sale people. It was an ok place to spend an afternoon.

Like the Premium Outlets North...except indoors, lower end, and cramped with center kiosks attempting to sell you garbage...so basically nothing like the Premium Outlets North and not really 'Premium' at all save for the Coach Store and perhaps Calvin Klein which is seemingly giving away their products at 25cents on the dollar during most visits.  Good for staples but certainly not the designer shopping experience it bills itself to be there are gems to be found for those willing to shop around but on the whole this is just another outlet mall, no more and no less.

Good outlets close to the strip!  

A good selection of stores with decent prices.  I would say to know your prices first. Some stores had deals that weren't such good deals.  It's an easy layout to navigate. We came in one end and did a lap around the entire mall.  It's actually set up more like a mall.  Plenty of places to eat; mostly quick service with a food court.  There are some stores that are accessible from the outside only. 

One gripe: The pushy kiosk workers.  When navigating the mall, we were constantly asked how our day was going or if we wanted some sample of rejuvenating cream. We politely replied "no thank you", but it got old once we were heading back to the entrance.

This location is easy for me as a local and (insert disclaimer) I believe has more of a selection and stock versus the other location. Parking is a hell of a lot easier;)
The staff always available and willing to go that 'extra mile' and check the back room stock, or call the other location. If all fails, they suggest other ways of searching for the Adidas merchandise you  so desire.  A little over a year ago I was interested in customizing a pair of Adidas online, went to this location for the sizing of the style I was interested in ordering online. They were custom and would take a month:( Told them and they assisted!
Now, Mario whom works here is an absolute pleasure.  Friendly, always around the store overseeing that one is helped.  Even informed me of the tent sale they were having in the near future. This visits purchase: a pair of Adidas slides ( Captain America ) kid's.  That's right, a Marvel superhero and kid's- don't judge;)

Nowhere near as good as the outlet in Primm or The North location but worth the stop nonetheless.
there are not as many upscale outlets, more mainstream but there are still great deals to be found.
It doesn't get as full here and there is parking all around with many entrances.
Anything is better than paying retail or inflated strip shopping prices, so get your shopping fix at any of the 3 great Vegas outlets!

I love love love love these outlets!  If you are in Vegas and looking for some killer great high end outlet deals this is the place to go!

The outlet is HUGE and they have tons of great stores and places to eat and just enough kitschy kiosks to be fun without being over the top.

Parking is easy and we spent just over 2 hours walking around and shopping.  I left with some great Coach and Calvin Klein steals!  My mother picked up some awesome stuff from Layne Bryant.

I will absolutely be going back next time I am in Vegas. 

Minus one star because they don't have Kate Spade yet.

The one perk of this outlet is that is it fully indoor and with the Las Vegas he is a very good thing especially in the summertime. Compared to the northside outlet the stores in here are a little bit more in the lower price range so if you want more designer outlet that you might want to check the north premium outlet but keep in mind the north is all outdoor.

Since it is close to the strip on the weekend there are a lot of Torrance to keep that in mind but it seems like the deals are more towards the weekend rush. Parking is good there's a lot of parking space available and since it is in Las Vegas Blvd. there are a lot of restaurants in the area as well.

compared to the north outlet there is less of a crowd so if you have about an hour before your flight and you want to kill time this is a good place to go especially in the summertime.

Public service announcement: This place gets CROWDED.  And now back to your regularly scheduled review. 

Oddly, I'd never been here before yesterday.  I really do like the outlets on the north end and never had a reason to come to these.  But I figured I'd give them a shot after getting some flooring bids in the area.  I couldn't even walk through this place it was so damn crowded!  

There are quite a few stores here but the assortment doesn't seem as good as the ones on the other end.  There are some more "high end" outlet stores at the other one.  This one does have one big plus on a hot July day - most of it is INDOORS.  Oh, sweet air conditioning.  

Can't see a reason I'd come back here.  My AC works well at home when I'm shopping online and there are no crowds there.

Formally known as the BELTZ Outlet, the LV Premium Outlets South is quite an understatement.

The only places that they've got going for them are:
- Coach
- Nike
- Michael Kors
- Gap & Banana Republic

They've done an upgrade to the place, although the interior still needs to be worked on. There are a couple shops that I feel don't even belong as an outlet store. I feel that most of the places here are just last year's items or merchandise made specifically for outlets to sell. Like they just put a nice brand name label to unworthy quality of goods!

Like all malls, they have independent kiosk shops that sell frou frou items that nobody ends up purchasing! Pillow pets?! Hair straighteners?! Massage?!

Overall thought: Just be cautious purchasing items at outlet stores, it might be best to take your money elsewhere for decent quality than a cheap-made-for-outlet-item that will only be worth 2-3 wears before it gets worn down. I prefer the Charleston Outlets (off the 15) over this one.

Ehhh Its ok. I liked it before they remade it over. The deals were better before then too. The food court is still the same. And people in the kiosks are pushing stuff on you, that you clearly dont need. But as with everything look hard enough and you will find a deal hiding somewhere. Also if you dont want the food in the court. Good restaurants in the surrounding parking lot arent in short supply either.

I have been coming here for years and I like the new upgrade with the outdoor stores. I am sad that iZod will be leaving in May but this means we'll have to find another place for us to find men's shorts...
The Starbucks only has one brewer so there is no options on favors. Pikes place is the only bold coffee. 
The other places are okay and I like the indoor part especially when it gets hot.  But the other outlets has stores that I like to visit.   That makes it tough for us when we shop.

I think I went  here several years ago and I went back again during my latest Vegas trip.  I heard there's better bargains at the SOUTH, as opposed to the north outlet mall.  I had pactically forgotten how this place was and which stores they had, but this mall's OK.  There's definitely nothing upscale about it.  Just a basic outlet mall and close to the swap meet type appearance on the inside as you're walking through it.  I did find some black ankle boots from the Hush Puppies store there.  I like that they had a Dr. Scholl's shoe store there!  They have 2 food courts too.  By the way, I have never seen a New York & Company Outlet store, but this place has it.  Overall, I want to give it 2.5 stars.

This was one of the first, if not the first outlet mall in Las Vegas. With that being said, it has seen it's better days. With a name change and some renovation it is looking less dilapidated, but it is not quite there yet. 

The new exterior and outside shops hide the eye sore of an inside. The going out of business sale for Harry and David brought me back, but it was a quick in and out process. The new outlets give off a similar feel to the Charleston Outlets, but smaller. With the addition of little embellishments and improvements on the inside, it might go back to it's former glory. 

The shops offer great deals, but driving a little bit further to the aforementioned outdoor mall is a better experience. You get to walk around outside, the cheap deals, the facilities are well maintained.

Finally a place in Vegas that does not completely empty your pocketbook! I love having the outlets as a shopping option. They have all of my favorite stores too...Tory Burch, Nike, the 'bucks and many more. The Nike store is massive and stocked with goodies and steals. There's a parking garage and also valet parking. It's great on a day when you want to escape the strip for a bit! Very family friendly too.

Typical Outlet Mall.  Favorite stores were Hurley and Calvin Klein. I don't know what I expected from a Las Vegas Outlet Mall, but I was surprised that it wasn't any better than the Malls we have in Wisconsin. I did buy a few things, but I won't be using up valuable vacation time here on my future Vegas trips.
Lots of stores, and  loads of post Holiday sales......  I will recommend that you check this place out over the two weeks after of Christmas....

I'm not much for shopping, I do not like to just stroll down the mall and window shop.  I'm the kind a gal that likes to go to one store and be done, get in and get out.  I have my list or I know what I am looking for and go for it.  So this mall is hard for me to go with shopping in mind.  My husband and I usually go when relatives are here from out of town and we go just to keep them company.

We usually go in at one end, while my husband moves the car around to the other end so we walk one way and hit the car without having to double back.  One thing I do not like is the kiosk vender's.  The are in your face wanting to sell you something.  They do not take a gentle "no thank you" and I am not one to be mean.  There are a few good stores I usually hit, especially if I am looking for shoes, but, I get a better deal shopping on line.

Most of the stores have been around for a while, but it's refreshing to see some change.  Overall, a good place to shop, if you're into that!

Nice place to kill some time (if you need to) like we did before our flight home.

+ It's air conditioned
+ Lots of places to eat (food courts inside, restaurants like IHOP, Outback, Chilis, Chipotle, etc. outside)
+ A lot of shops that we don't have at home
+ Since it's an outlet mall, MOST of the stores offer decent prices
+ There's a carousel.  Our little ones spotted it (it's huge, so it's kind of hard to miss) and immediately had to ride it.  It was a nice diversion, but at $3.00 a ride it was a bit pricey.
+ Lots of parking

- I don't like to shop :-(

The mall was pretty big, it was indoor mall and cool inside. They have 2 food courts, and other snacks place like dunkin and pretzel. They have all the sport retail store that I most liked, and they have basic stores like other outlets mall

I love shopping for bargains, so I was very excited to start bargain hunting when my friend dropped me off here. It's a covered mall which is a big plus, especially when the weather outside gets too hot (one star). It has a variety of shops found at most malls and outlets (another star). It's in a convenient location that's a little off the hustle and bustle of the Strip (third star).

My state offers a lower sales tax, so I found myself skipping the places available at my local mall and going to the very few places I didn't have access to. However, I found that most of the pricing didn't seem to reflect their supposed outlet status. Most, if not all, of the stores I visited offered mostly the same selection that you would find at any other non-outlet mall store. 

I think international visitors might benefit more from this mall than domestic ones. But, it's still a good place to walk around and check out.

Like someone mentioned in the tips below: They give a discount pamphlet to AAA members. Get your pamphlet at the information kiosk.

This is a hard review to do, so I think this is best left to bulletpoint format until I get to my final point of contention.

The Goods:
* You can get some great clothing items for very good prices.
* They are currently remodeling the front-end, so hopefully the result will pay off for the Center.

The Bads:
* It's on the ass-end of the Strip.  You don't happen to wander upon this unless you are specifically looking for it, or get one of those motels down in that area (And why would you?).
* Other than the carousel, it's not very kid friendly, as all the stores that could have proven entertaining have closed down in the last year or so.  I'd suggest a babysitter, or pray they like hanging out in the food court.
* There's a few kitchen places, and one or two specialty stores, but largely, there's not a lot of diversity in the shopping experience.

Now.  For the biggest complaint.  And the reason I HATE coming out to this place.

The mall kiosk vendors.

Look, I did this sort of job once way back in the day.  Its not glamorous, and it's boring because you are usually stuck selling things no one really thinks about buying.  Or wants.  But I refer to this Outlet Center as "The Gauntlet".

Kiosk after kiosk of rude, pushy people who chase you down, yell at you from across the way, rub their wares on you whether you ask (or want) them to or not, and my favorite is when they actually stand in your way to block you and force you to stop.  And when you try to sidestep them, they sidestep WITH you to keep you blocked.  

Oh, Hell no.

At this point, you aren't going to get my business, but you are going to get something else from me.  And you're not going to like it.

It is what it is, and as long as you stick to the sides of the mall, or use some other customer as your sacrificial lamb walking through to "feed" the kiosk people, you can find some nice clothing options here.  Anything else, it's not what you could call an "exciting" shopping experience.

These outlets have a good selection and the air conditioning is a plus when its hot. Prices are not as great as in the past, meaning I see no difference from the deals here or a regular mall. There are some stores that flat out have the same prices as regular. The only other drawback is there are sections where cell service is non-existent.

This outlet mall has drastically improved! It is no longer the quiet boring mall with only two good stores.  Now it's got many great stores such as Michael Kors, DKNY, True Religion, Coach Men's, and Under Armour.  

Many of the new stores are only accessible from the outside. So if you're inside the mall and you can't find a certain store but you know it's there cause you've seen it on the directory, well,  just exit the mall and you'll find that store you're looking for.

I came here last night to shop at the Levi's store and unfortunately there were no good sales so I left without buying anything. Very rare for me.

There is plenty of parking and I do have a favorite spot to park at just because there is less traffic and easier for me to enter and exit the lot.

By the way, this mall opens at midnight on Black Friday (Friday after Thanksgiving) and I was here last year for it and OMG, it was sooo packed!

Love shopping this mall. You can find the latest and greatest fashions here for a lot less than you would at a regular mall. One of my favorite stores, Burlington Brands is gone and I'm sad to see it go. I bought a lot of my work gear from there.

I frequent Rue 21, Calvin Kline amongst others. The one annoying thing here is the retail carts in the walkway of the mall. I swear you cannot take two steps without one of the super aggressive and annoying people that work them stopping you and trying to get you to sample what they are selling. So annoying!!!! Hint....everything those carts sell is overpriced! The shops in this mall are super cheap, but the items at all of these carts are way overpriced! Don't get duped!! 

Last, bring your walking shoes. This place is huge! Meaning, it is long. One-story, so you'll be walking for a long, long time! Three stars due to the annoying cart salespeople. Otherwise, four stars.
Blew a tonne of money here, more than in the Casinos! Plenty of great shops and some ridiculously good bargains (although that was during the 4th of July sales). The food court is pretty OK.

Don't get me wrong.. I love vintage goods and vintage stores when that is what is intended. I don't think i am supposed to get the feeling that I am window shopping in the 80's while walking around this place but needless to say I do.  The air is stale the isles are very narrow, thus making it feel like you are at a fair when you walk by the midway games and carnies nag you to play the game, this is the same thing with the accented people working the booths in the middle, sometimes I just want to tell them no I don't want 5 balls for a dollar and I know I am really not guaranteed to win... Back to those isles and how narrow they are, which depending on my mood sometimes makes me want to clothes line someone just to say I did. But then the inner Raymond speaks to me and Says..... psssss, hey don't do it. So needless to say I have never done it. The only other plus that I have found here is the quality of the people watching.. Man you can tell a story just by looking at some of the clientele that walks around in this place, maybe one day I will stop one of them and ask them for their name and location and I will yelp about them.

The Ups and downs are as follows:

Ups:
People watching
Claw machines around every corner " I love those stupid things"
Close to my house

Downs:
The prices are relatively high and are not outlet deals
Smells funny
Ugly decor
Narrow walkways 
Odd store selection

I guess if you are bored and have nothing better to do this is always an option but I don't know that i would make it my first option.
i hit jackpot here, 50% off at the Coach outlet, you gotta be here at a certain time of the year to get those 50% off! gotta luv the outlet stores, especially the premium ones!

Never knew that there was such a wonderful outlet mall in Vegas! Friendly and helpful sales associates, great food/snack options for when you need a shopping break, many shoe stores and brand name retailers with amazing prices (true bargains) - will definitely make a stop here again on another visit

This mall is really depressing and there are no good stores. I felt like the food courts had more people than the rest of the mall. 

We walked through the whole mall in about an hour or less. They do not have anything. Waste of time.

First time going through here and glad my boyfriend and I stopped by before heading out.

I really like how a lot of their shops were indoors like a mall because the heat was definitely getting to us when we went early Sunday morning. There were definitely a bunch of stores that I recognized, such as Addidas, Aerosoles, Hot Topic, and Vans. But there were also some that we didn't recognized, but enjoyed window shopping as we jumped from store to store that caught our eyes. Some of the stores were having sales going on either as a promotional thing they did or just because they were outlet versions of stores you would see at the mall and such.

They do have two food court areas and some restroom stalls for your convenience placed inside the outlet. And we were able to check out the other stores outside of the indoor outlet. There were other restaurants outside that we recognized, such as Buffalo Wild Wings, but they were on the other side of the parking lot across from the outlet stores and just too far to go over there in the heat.

My boyfriend and I did end up buying some stuff that were on sale before heading out on to the road.

Chintzy. Ghetto. Waste of time. I don't care if the are expanding!! Even the seasonal holiday stores (Halloween costumes, calendars etc) look better than this place!

Don't let the word "outlet" fool you.... there isn't much to see here. A Levi's outlet... a Hot Topic outlet... discount Corningware... WHOOO!

I'm actually sitting into the car writing this review right now while I wait for extended family to browse through this craphole. And that says a lot about how bad this place is, since I NEVER say no to shopping!!
Don't waste your time, there are no good shops here at all.  Try the Premium outlets, they seem much better from the store listings and from passing it on the freeway.

The interior needs an update for sure. This outlet mall will always be known as the Belz outlet to me as that was the old name for it back in the day. The exterior of the entire outlet mall has been redone to match more modern outlets but the inside of the place looks outdated. I mainly just go here for Nike and is usually my first stop after flying in and picking up my rental as the facility is located on nearby Gillespie St.

There are plenty of other stores such as Adidas, Osh Kosh, Disney store, etc but there are also some that you would expect to be there but are not. For the life of me, we couldnt find Banana Republic or Gap. And I was sure we walked the entirety of the place. 

Plenty of parking. It can be very busy at times especially on the weekends. Just avoid the high traffic times and bring some patience when it comes to parking and you'll be fine.

Although this place isn't as big as the the Fashion Outlets of Las Vegas in Primm, there are still a lot of great stores and selections!

Some of the store selections include Coach, Michael Kors, Levi's, PacSun, Express, Hot Topic, Zumiez, Swarovski, Disney Store, and The Children's Place. The map of the place is simple. The whole mall has indoor and outdoor components, which sets it apart from the outlet in Primm (it's all indoors).

The honey was able to get 4 pairs of Levi's jeans, which were all under $20 and a bunch of shirts from Hot Topic (they had a BOGO deal). Overall, this is a great place for not only shopping, but a hanging out/sightseeing place for families and friends too.

WHAT IS WRONG WITH THIS PUSHY KIOSK VENDORS????
Being latina but living in Vegas not once but twice in one visit I was confused by a tourist and stop for two different vendora to try the products. I dont want to, I tell them but they keep talking as they can't listen to what I saying. Im a really polite and nice person but this is almost harassment at the middle of the Mall, they speak really loud and I just don't  understand how the manager don't do something about it. 
If I say no thanks thats it.
If I want your product I will let you know. 
What bothers me the most its they do this specially to tourist who sometimes don't understand what the heck is going on. 
Cmon people this suppose to be a nice place and I don't expect to be yell at when Im shopping.
Hugo Boss here is not that good. It lacks many things especially accessories.

I like this place. Has my sean john, nautica and ecko cheap clothes. My wife and i shop the whole mall looking for good deal. Always leave with bags from here. My favorite mall in vegas, no show all go. Must go if you are on a budget, or just like getting stuff cheaper than other malls.

One star- nice cashiers. All asking where I was from and genuinely nice. The Lucky Store, my guy scored two pairs of his fave jeans (Triumph) and was helped by a super nice asian guy (regret that I forgot his name) for $29.99 each!!!!
Two stars- nice big selection of food courts
Three stars- easy taxi accessibility

- 1 star- not a lot of designer stores AT ALL (should've headed to the north outlet mall for my kate spade and Ferragamo). Eh, oh well. 
- 1 star- dirty bathrooms. Yuck.

The kimco services sucks at there job ! The mall is always dirty . The restrooms are disgusting .. they need to bring back the old company .. this mall how's gone down since kimco took over .. and the management is shitty never working !

This is the older outlet mall in Las Vegas and it's not as shiny as its newer counterpart downtown but judge a book by it's cover! It has a number of stores that offer incredible deals because they have new competition a few miles away! One of my favorites is the Sean John Factory Store (only one in Las Vegas), it has the same product you'll find in the department stores at unbelievable prices! When you're next in Las Vegas, visit the Las Vegas Outlet Center and the Sean John Factory Store!

Clothes, clothes, clothes what more can I say than to come here and fill your closet with more clothes. I came here because I need something warm for my son to wear during a football tournament in November. I did pick up the free coupon book thanks to a Yelp Check in. That coupon book did save me $5 at Under Armor so I do suggest getting it if you planning on doing some big spending. I wasn't impressed with the sales since I live next to an outlet in Los Angeles and I am used to the price cuts but if you don't have that luxury definitely some great buys. Next time you come to Sin City you come and drop a couple hundred hear and you will always come out a winner.

I was impressed by this outlet mall bc I found it to not have any empty retail spaces. That's rare nowadays as people love to shop online. Plus they have several food courts in there as well as fast food restaurants in the parking lot. You know most shopping centers their food courts are very unappealing most of the time.

We parked on the south end. OK what end is that? LOL Then walked to the north end and back. Parking was very plentiful & free. Be sure to wear your walking shoes as I wore my stylish non-comfortable boots! I would have preferred my more comfy athletic shoes. 

We came on a Friday the first of December so it was a gorgeous day outside. Yes 67 degrees! But if you come during the hot summer the air conditioned all indoor mall will be your respite for sure!

Get ready to go shopping bc there are some deals to be had. For example: Lucky, Disney, Chico's, Spencer's, Clark's & more piqued my interest. Aerosoles currently was undergoing an out of business sale. Go shopping now! Can someone pick up that purple flowery top for me from Chico's & bring it back to Cali? Never mind I bought it online! LOL

Always stop here because we always find great deals at this store. My husband picked up a watch at Kenneth Cole that was 40% off. A great deal. The gentleman helping us was so nice, well dressed and very helpful with our purchase.
We got great deals at the Ecko Unlimited store. Picked up some shorts for $19.99 and graphic t's for $9.99, cant go wrong.

Compared to the North Premium Outlet Mall this one is a bit of a letdown.  They recently remodeled the exterior and added some new stores, but the interior is just as old, dated and dodgy as ever.

Do yourself a favor and just head to the North Premium Outlet Mall.

If you have been to the North Outlet Mall and didn't find what you needed there then perhaps head to this location - I do this for the Adidas and Timberland stores, but I then leave as quickly as possible.

The best part of this mall is that there are a bunch of restaurants between the mall and Las Vegas Blvd (still in the parking lot for the mall) - our favorite is Chipotle, but there are a bunch of choices.

We always make it a point to do some shopping here whenever get get to Vegas. Good deals and plenty stores. That being said, Black Friday is nuts!!!   You can hardly move in here. No place to sit and eat.  It is just plain crowded. Oh well, I kind of did expect this.

Once in a while when I'm in Las Vegas, I like to stop by this outlet mall near the Las Vegas McCarran International airport area............... the Las Vegas South Premium Outlet.

If you're looking for a deal, you may consider checking this mall out. To me, it's like any other outlet mall that I would go to in California, or in my home state- da 808. 
Only difference is this particular outlet mall in Las Vegas is Mega Huge!!!! Therefore, this outlet mall probably has more stores then your average outlet mall...........

If you're not into shopping, this mall still has a purpose................ as you can walk this huge mall for exercise! 
A nice feature about the Las Vegas South Premium Outlet is that this mall is an "indoor mall", so in the hot summers you won't have to worry about the extreme Las Vegas heat, and in the winter you won't have to worry about the cold weather either.

There are tons of stores in this mall, as well as two food courts. Some of my favorite stores I like to check out are - Nike, Under Armour, Quiksilver, Converse, & Vans.

The list of stores at this outlet mall are pretty endless........too many stores to mention here, so I will just post a link so you can see the various stores & eateries at this outlet mall.

http://www.premiumoutlets.com/outlet/las-vegas-south/stores

If for some reason you don't have a car to get to the Las Vegas South Premium Outlet mall, no need to fret, as there is a smaller version of this outlet mall near the downtown Las Vegas area called - the Las Vegas North Premium Outlet. 

The North Premium Outlet may not be as big, or have as much stores, but if you just happen to stay at a hotel in the downtown area like - the California Hotel, Fremont, Four Queens, Golden Nugget, Main Street, The D, Plaza Hotel, or Downtown Grand Hotel, the North Premium Outlet Mall is not too far away from these downtown hotels........... 

You can probably take a long walk, catch a bus, or even a taxi down to the North Premium Outlet Mall, as it's not too far away.

Overall, I'd rather go to the Las Vegas South Premium Outlet Mall, as I like the indoor shopping atmosphere..

Comfortable shopping, all quality brands available, some store are mostly retail , not outlets. Compared to Cabazon and Ontario outlet malls, store assistants are not very helpfull offering discounts or giving additional discount options.  Shopped in November , so sun and heat were not a problem. We actually enjoyed sitting in the corridors. Lots of seating areas. Smoking is allowed , perk for smokers and problem for non smokers. Great shopping experience, missing star for store personnel ( by the way, i had none, it is a general observation) , the other half missing is for potential extreme heat in summer.  Take a hat if going anytime after april. Have fun and enjoy

Hm.  I don't see why the lower review.

I didn't even know about this outlet... only the north one.  This one is better for one main reason.  IT'S INDOORSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS.  Indoors = AC = happiness in Vegas.

That is all.

Actually, parking is much better than the other outlet as well :)

That is all.

When I first moved here in 2000 this was known as Belz mall and was the go to place for most of my shopping needs. I still think they have the best Nike outlet store around.

I went to buy some work pants, so I basically knew I wasn't going any farther than the first section where Nike is located, and of course where Haggar is. Haggar has been my go to place for work pants and shorts for a long time, and they didn't disappoint with $18 pairs of slacks. I think all this Yelping is expanding my waistline so I needed some bigger pants as most of my old stuff don't fit me no more. The nice part about Haggar is the flexible waist band that allows for some growth. 

I also snuck in the Kitchen Connection store which has some quality items at decent prices, as well as some discount items that come in handy. I got some screens for pans so grease don't splatter, a mini dip warming dish, and some silver bowls for pre-measured ingrediants. Now all I have to do is learn how to cook.

I did notice a Columbia Sportswear store where the old Burlington used to be, but didn't go in. They usually have quality stuff. Will have to check them out.

Lots and lots of mid-hallway vendors....almost too many. And the usual influx of tourists who don't speak English, blocking doorways and generally have no respect for their fellow man.

This place is always a total madhouse, but with lots of men's and women's clothing, lingerie, housewares, and other shops it's sort of become a discount Mecca. I love to come here for the discount shoes, the Billabong store, the lane Bryant, and the Roxy Quiksilver shop. There are plenty of friends that are empty right now, and both of the food courts are kind of lacking, but there are food options if you need them. Be prepared to walk behind slow poke idiots who don't know where they are going..

Outlets are a hit or miss, depending what you're going for. They have a good alternative selection of brands (Element, Fox, Hurley, Vans, Converse, etc.) if you're into those brands, and also have other brands such as Coach, Charlotte Russe, and Windsor if you're into the others. 

The Outlets are a hit or miss because there are some stores you can get good deals on, and others are plain expensive. They just remolded everything from the outside in, so the interior/exterior decor is more modernized and cleaned up (which is always a plus). I believe the only major accredited store in the Outlets is Coach, and everything else is more of the secondary brands you hear that aren't top dogs but are still known. Still worth to give this place a browse through though, you might find something good.

South outlet is pretty good if you're into outlet malls. Every time I go it seems like the place is packed with more of a "tourist-y" crowd looking for those Outlet deals. 

They have a great selection of stores that include some of the "classier" outlets as well. I'm getting pretty partial to Hugo. . 

You need a Starbucks and a place to chill for a bit at the halfway mark they have you covered. 

The one thing I do find annoying is the vendors in the center of the walkways, the carts, can be a little pushy st times. Gives me the bazaar feel. I more or less like to just go shopping and not be annoyed so I'm pretty grateful when I pass by a cart and there is already some other potential "customer" being helped. 

All in all it's a place to go to spend some dough when you're in the deal mode of going to an outlet.

Nachdem wir die Las Vegas North Premium Outlets schon mehrfach aufgesucht hatten, wollten wir jetzt auch mal die Las Vegas South Premium Outlets entdecken. Aufgrund der teilweise negativen Berichte hatten wir uns bisher dort nicht blicken lassen.

Unter anderem findet man hier Adidas, Ann Taylor, Armani, Boss, Calvin Klein, Coach, Cole Haan, DKNY, Guess, Ascics, Levis, Nike, Michael Kors, Nautica, Reebok, Timberland, Tommy Hilfiger, Polo Ralph Lauren und Under Armour, um nur einige zu nennen. Insgesamt findet man hier 145 Stores.

Auch wenn keine aktuelle Sales Aktion war konnte man wirklich sehr gute Einsparungen erzielen. Vorher sollte man ggf. auf der Homepage nach Coupons oder Aktionen suchen. Ich konnte 2 Paar Schuhe von Timberland für ca. 50 Dollar kaufen. Beide Paare waren um 70 % runtergesetzt und das zweite Paar wurde dann nochmals um 50 % reduziert. Da macht das Einkaufen Spaß.

Die Outlet Mall ist in einem Gebäude, schön klimatisiert und macht einen sehr gepflegten Eindruck. Der Food Court macht einen ansprechenden Eindruck. Kostenlose Parkplätze sind ausreichend vorhanden. Am Wochenende kann es schon mal sehr voll werden.

Insgesamt ein empfehlenswertes Outlet mit einer guten Auswahl von Geschäften. Ich würde es immer dem Las Vegas North Premium Outlet vorziehen.
Not bad outlet mall....they renovate and open new stores but still the outlet north much better with their store choices.

We always make an attempt to stop by to check out what is in store when we are in the neighborhood. We like a lot of the stores in this outlet mall so we always have a good chance in finding something we are looking for! 

We noticed this time that the cart vendors were not so aggressive and pushy this time as we strolled through the mall. It was actually a peaceful stroll from store to store for us. I wonder if someone said something to them or complained, or maybe they were simply all tired? It was a major difference this time as in past visits where we would be mobbed by every cart vendor. Anyhow it was refreshing to be left alone because, No I don't want my ring cleaned... No I don't want to ruin my nails by testing your magic nail polish...No I don't want to watch you iron and press a shirt...No I don't want you to ruin my makeup with a crappy facial in public because your cleanser will not magically make me look or feel younger....catch my drift?

My honey bunches of oats loves DC so I enjoy checking out the Lids store for new DC caps for him. 

This visit we hit the jackpot at The Converse store (see review).

This outlet mall is worth checking out for sure as there is a lot of great merchandise for a fraction of the cost indeed!








I am very kinky.

This is the BEST outlet mall I have ever been too! It was a little packed but it is outlets so that is expected. Great deals tons and tons of stores from high end spots to normal spots. I could be there from open to close

This place has a little bit of everything. From high end brands to brands you've never heard of. Majority of the stores are inside and a few are outside. It does get pretty crowded here even when you are just walking around - window shopping.

This place looks really old and run down and when you get inside you feel the same. theres tons of brands and most of which have great sales going on. 

be weary of the kiosks. those guys are salesmen to the umpteenth power. 

theres food shops here and there but the 3 times ive visited the mall ive only went for the shopping and im outty.. no need to overstay such an unwelcoming experience.

Las Vegas South Premium Outlets is the sister outlet mall to the North Premium Outlets.  I usually prefer going to these outlets over the North Outlets because South is indoors.  It can get rough shopping in triple digit weather.  If I wrote this review a couple of years ago, I would've given it 2.5-3 stars based on the variety of stores this mall has.  I was stoked when I re-visited in November 2014 and found that a bunch of new stores had opened, including one of my favorites-Express.    

There's ample parking here and the mall is anchored at the entrances by the higher end outlets like Coach, Michael Kors and Guess.  They have a food court in the middle of the mall, kiosks spread out between all of the stores and my favorite kiosk right at the middle entrance, Dunkin' Donuts. 

This is a great little strip mall that's constantly changing due to the turnover in stores but the variety's usually not bad and its location can't be beat.  These outlets are just a few minutes away from McCarran International airport and really easy to find.
Love some of the stores, but hate the center isle hawkers who do not take NO for an answer!  Also, most prices are full retail..just say'in.

I love to hate this mall, it is always so crowded with tourists, tourists that are rude and have no idea how to walk the halls of a shopping mall. 

If you are a local, go at night.... An hour before closing and you are lucky enough to get in and out with everything you need, less the stress of the people that stop right in front of you, elbow you, smell funny Etc.

You are sure to get a deal but watch for the return policy, seems they have a stricter policy in place than if you are to visit the same store outside this mall. 

Also, if you want deals, pick up the magazine near the map..... It has coupons in it.

This is a decent outlet mall located on the far south end of the Las Vegas strip. It has a good mix of high-end (Coach, Michael Kors, Kate Spade) and non high-end stores (Vanity Fair/Wrangler/Lee store), and the majority of the stores are located inside the mall (nice for the hot, sweltering days). 

While here, the hubby and I discovered a Citizen watch store. Being huge fans of their Eco Drive watches, we had to stop in. Hubby didn't buy anything, but I found a great watch for only $99! 

If you get hungry, there is a large food court here, and there is a popcorn stand that you can smell from a mile away as well. 

One thing that I do wish the mall would crack down on are the kiosk associates and their aggressive nature.
