At least 3 times on our most recent trip here, we had kiosk workers practically leap out at us and yell to get our attention like carnival barkers. I absolutely cannot stand that. Listen, if I am at all interested in what you're selling, I will approach you. Okay? I also feel that there are way too many kiosks in the mall, period. It makes things rather congested when walking in the mall. Whoever is in charge of the mall, please look into this.

Tons of stores to chose from and ample parking but this place just has a strange vibe every time I walk in. I have no idea why it's just strange! Go early in the day because this place becomes overrun with tourists.

They do have a few places to eat in the food courts your typical mall fast foods. The place is kept reasonably clean for how busy it gets. Be careful crossing the parking lot though between tourists in rental cars having no clue where they are going and the ever persistent crazy taxi drivers it can be a tad bit dangerous out there.

Not my favorite outlet mall in Vegas, for you bay areans it reminds me a lot of Southland, except this place smells like feet.  

My favorite stores in here are the Hot Topic and Coach Outlets.  The Coach store here seems to have a really good selection here and I've bough oh about 3 purses there so far!

I have been coming to these outlets since they used be called Belz. Honestly, I still call them that most of the time and probably won't stop any time soon. They have had a lot of renovation of this mall over the years and the result is positive.

I always enjoy perusing the stores and kiosks when I'm in the area. Not a huge fan of having the mall split up between the main portion and the annex, since I have to get back in my car and repark if I want to check out any of the stores on the side. Overall, I enjoy this outlet mall quite a bit and have been frequenting it quite a bit more lately since I work in the area.

Update Review!  Needed to give Las Vegas South Premium Outlets an upgrade.  Why?  The answer is because they have finished the makeover I requested!  Alright, maybe they did not have the makeover cause I mentioned it a few years ago.  Still, cool to think that I may have influenced it.  ;)

I must maintain that the best thing that I like about this outlet mall is that it is indoors so there is air conditioning!!  It is great to come here during the hot summer months.  The selection of stores is better now, but not as good as their sister outlet in town.  The selection of restaurants at their food courts appear improved also.  After this makeover, the place is more crowded so parking is difficult to find sometimes now.  I like walking around and browsing while my wife shops away.  There are deals to be found if you look hard enough.

Have to say that I am now a fan of the Las Vegas South Premium Outlet Mall.

I get to go here every time I come to Vegas with my wife. She likes to shop and I do somewhat. This a large covered indoor shopping mall that is supposed to be items at a discount price. And in most cases that is true, but you have to know what the price is else where to know you are getting a deal. Me I get my Birkenstofck sandals here. You can get them just a cheep from other place mail order. But here I can try them on and make sure they are what I want. I like the kitchen shops and they used to have Black and Decker but no more. Boo. They used to have Wolf camera but no more. again Boo. For your wife they have a bunch of places to shop but for me it is limited to a few stores. As in most malls there are people in the center isles/walkways trying to sell you stuff you don't meed. There is a Starbucks for the Starbuck fans.

This outlet mall is outdated, hard to navigate and is really more like a large strip mall.

There was a sign on the North end of the building for the only store I wanted to go to - Skechers.  I parked there in hopes of getting in and out quickly.  Skechers is on the farthest South end of the building.  You live, you learn.

I wouldn't come here again, as the inside reminds me of a ghetto strip mall.  It has some "higher-end" stores, but most of the stuff is off-season or similarly priced to the regular mall.
